Reviews.Title: “Much better than that expensive resort.”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: We started our Key West stay at the very expensive Casa Marina resort. We had an upgraded room, and would have to see the lower grade because we were cramped in a small room with poor ventilation and poor cooling system. For our last night, we moved to the Fairfield Inn and loved the place. Big spacious room, nice pool, breakfast by the pool included in the rate. We should have stayed at Fairfield the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant spring break experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie F
Reviews.Content: As a parent, I could really appreciate the "no party" policy during spring break. The hotel was quiet and relaxing, just what we needed after two long days of site seeing, and taking photos for business only two miles away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dglander
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel went out of their way to help make our stay fun during my husband's birthday weekend. The pool is the best on the island.

Reviews.Title: “way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: stevensusan
Reviews.Content: far from duval street and no free shuttle despite the marriot courtyard up the road providing one. pool is nice and breakfaast assortment was better than anticipated. i suspect we were in the older part of the hotel with a double room. it was clean but window opened to walkway so no privacy and room was tiny, no desk etc. we were originally going to stay 2 nights but at $359/night, no way. we were abe to get a special rate at the casa marina resort for $379/night with a $100 credit for resort acgtivities etc and it included a complete breakfast buffet. Maybe a studio suite at this hotel could barey justify their price but certainly not a room on par with a Days Inn

Reviews.Title: “Sleep, Eat, Go!”
Reviews.Author: Sniffsthepig
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, liked the separation of toilet/glass shower and the sink. Thank you! Breakfast was a pleasant surprise with lots of options. Pool area was nice with well-kept landscaping. Rent a bike (I recommend Eaton closer to downtown - they have lights) and enjoy the ride into town - cheaper than taxi's in the end and not too long of a ride. Be sure to have a light on your bike since it's illegal not to after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: lindacarlson12
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. The reception staff was very helpful. We picked up the trolly tour at the hotel. Very convient.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike3267
Reviews.Content: Room old but clean - Staff very helpful - good location in that the trolley stops in front of the hotel - hotel also has on site bike & scoter rental. Hotel is about 1&1/2 miles from the center of activities. Keep in mind that Key West is only 2 miles by 4 miles and completely flat so a bike or a taxi is the easiest way to get around - parking downtown can cost $20/day. After a day of the tourist attractions â€“ I found it difficult to find something to do ( we do not drink or fish).

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sheril S
Reviews.Content: Two pluses and two minuses. The pluses: 1) the hotel room was very clean, and I'm a pretty picky person when it comes to this area of a hotel stay; 2) free breakfast by the pool. The minuses: 1) of the two room keys I received, only one worked, and not all the time. So each time I had to go into my room, I had to go back and forth between keys four or five times before the door would open; 2) the wi-fi access was quite slow and intermittently at best. Key West hotels run pretty expensive, so though this hotel was a little pricey for the size of the room, it was overall a good deal on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but not highly handicap accessible.”
Reviews.Author: Curtiss B
Reviews.Content: Don't understand rationale for Fairfield Inn custom of NOT placing water cups in the same room as the water tap! One arrives at room thirsty, finds a water tap in the bathroom but then finds that he/she needs to try to cup hands together to have a simple drink of water! Frustrated, the still thirsty traveler now starts a 'where are the cups" hunt? Is there some logical reason why water cups should not be placed in the same room as the water source? Also puzzled at Fairfield's practice of NOT putting water cups in the same room as the water tap? The thirsty traveler arrives at the hotel, finds the water tap in the bathroom. but no cups!? The immediate alternative is to cup hands to drink! Or leave the bathroom and embark on a cup search elsewhere in the apartment! I am at a loss to guess the reason for thus incovenient strategy ???

Reviews.Title: “Knowledgeable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lovinlifeFlorida
Reviews.Content: While in Key West we prefer to stay at B&Bs near downtown, the Fairfield Inn & Suites is an acceptable alternative despite being more than two miles from Duval Street. My wife and I stayed there for three nights smack during high-priced, high-tourist season. The cost, however, was reasonable given the season. While Fairfields are in many respects average hotels, what sets this one apart is the knowledgeable, friendly staff. For instance, their recommendations of restaurants and attractions were terrific. They were most accommodating in every respect. In fact, they sought out their guests to be sure they were comfortable and had everything they needed. Our room was small but clean and stocked with all the amenities we would need. The AC was noisy when it came on. The pool area was of a quality one would expect at a four-star hotel. The outside bar and adjacent continental breakfast area spacious. All in all, if we couldn't be closer to the action downtown, the Fairfield did nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Good....but you might want to avoid the small standard rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cyberdad
Reviews.Content: I am lifetime platinum with Marriott and booked my room on reward points. The hotel has a lot going for it. Great staff....one of the friendliest and most helpful anywhere. There's also a large, clean, pool situated in very inviting surroundings. Another plus is an above-average complimentary breakfast buffet served poolside. In the afternoon, the breakfast area adjoining turns into a fun and friendly Tiki Bar....also very nice. Location is about a 5-10 minute drive from Duval Street shopping, dining, and nightlife. (Cabs are fairly plentiful and relatively cheap), The only problem here during my stay was the room. Clean, bright, and equipped with comfy bedding, but very small. We had three people (me, wife, and young adult son), and we kept bumping into each other. Very little storage space for luggage, etc. I did notice that they had what appeared to be larger rooms and suites. So my advice would be to book one of those (and expect to pay a little more), unless you're traveling solo, not planning spending time in the room (this IS Key West), or otherwise don't mind having limited space.

Reviews.Title: “Small isn't quite the word for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RD24
Reviews.Content: Jimmy Buffett might have stayed here, and he would have easily found that lost shaker of salt in these very small (RV sized) rooms! So small that you could easily pole vault from the beds to the bath and back in a single attempt (I did not attempt it) The room had plantation shutters and no drapes so we enjoyed ambient LED lighting from outside all night. In the finest highway gas station rest room tradition the sink had neglected to have a drain stopper, a bow to water conservation or whatever, The toilet had an interesting sign on the lid proudly proclaiming its inefficiency with high contents. All this for ONLY $279 per night!. Staff were great, however. Breakfast good as well. Think small, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, mildewy rooms”
Reviews.Author: G P
Reviews.Content: I'm a loyal Marriott customer, but this was my first time at a Fairfield Inn - and my first time in Key West. First, the positive: the hotel staff was very helpful, the pool is even nicer than the photos, and eventhough the room doors open to the oustide there's a great seal on the door and no bugs anywhere in site on the property. Now, the negative: the shower was mildewy and smelly - you couldn't get any air circulation in there with the fan because the glass door went all the way to the ceiling, there was no where to hang wet pool clothes, the breakfast (although in a great outside setting by the pool) wasn't that great, also it took 25 minutes to get cabs to go go the sunset festival, the heater/AC was so loud you could hardly sleep, the bed was hard, my husband and I (both relatively fit people) could hardly fit in the double bed - which was the only room type available, and the desk chair was mildewy. It's too bad because of the friendly staff, but I definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn Key West”
Reviews.Author: Marco J
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very friendly and helpful for suggestions to get around Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: anneh4171
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Fairfield in Key West for a weekend in February 2012. I was pleassantly surprised at how well the hotel fit in to the Key West atmosphere. I am used to Marriotts being the same everywhere, but this one had amenities you don't usually find. the pool was great, larger than normal and not the standard rectangular pool. The rooms were comfortable and clean - a bit small, but who stays in their room in Key West anyway? There were moped and electric car rentals available, and I was VERY impressed with the breakfast area! It was outside on a veranda and there was actual staff handling the service and the food. There was also a tiki bar near the pool. I would DEFINITELY go back!

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Onemoremike
Reviews.Content: I visit Key West once a month. I have stayed in a number of places on the island. This is the best value I have found. The rooms are nice. The location is close enough to the fun spots, yet far enough away that you can actually park your car at your own hotel. (For free and under cover) The staff has always been energetically friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. To keep it fair; the rooms are not brand new but they are clean and in good repair. The one thing Iâ€™d like different is a restaurant within walking distance. But Iâ€™ve stayed at those places and they are not as good a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: EnforcerFan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small. No frig in my room. No smoking throughout property. Continental breakfast not worth it. Nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel... Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MEHarse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a ways from downtown (2 miles) and does not have a view of the ocean so don't stay here if that is what you are looking for! Otherwise, this hotel is very nice. The staff are great, everyone from the front desk staff to the cleaning service. The continential breakfast has great variety making longer stays nice due to variety.

Reviews.Title: “3 Great Nights in Key West”
Reviews.Author: flashot
Reviews.Content: The wife and I are fresh back from 3 days at the Fairfield inn Key West. What a great experience. The Fairfield was very clean and appeared to be recently remodeled. The pool was a great place to kick back and relax before heading down to Duval to be with the crazies. The breakfast was better than most places with a great selection. Starting off the day sitting outside having our first cup of coffee poolside was the best. Most of all the Staff was very sincere about our helping us out and could not do enough to make sure we had a great stay day. They succeeded!

Reviews.Title: “Old lumpy beds”
Reviews.Author: rsjg911
Reviews.Content: Big disappointment. Tile floors, noisy AC, outside doors, noisy from room above and when neighbor's doors closed. Won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “key west adventure”
Reviews.Author: mtneer2
Reviews.Content: The staff were all friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable. We had AC system running and did not notice noise reported by other reviewers. The pool and grounds were well maintained and nice for relaxing. Guest laundry was clean and functional. We were on bicycles, otherwise it is a bit of a hike to a good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: jdanis53
Reviews.Content: A disappointment for a long time Marriot fan. We used points for our stay instead of paying the $259. With that you probably get one of the worst located rooms which we did. It was impossible to sleep. Whenever the needed A/C kicked on it woke you up. Water flow from the sink faucet was anemic making shaving etc. a lengthy process. Papers were never available in the front office either all out or delayed in arriving. Breakfast and the pool were fine but the motel should have been razed instead of renovated. Joe53

Reviews.Title: “not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: KValente
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with the front desk staff at all- they could not have cared less. No welcome package or thank you to Marriott reward holders. Room was spacious, bed comfortable, but the noise level when you are facing the pool late in the night was bothersome. Gusts making loud noises late into the night did not make for a restful sleep. The bathroom was not clean at all. Glad I was only staying one night, sorry I had to use up all those points. After unpacking went to the bar area and then the front desk to get a few glasses- they do not exist on the property. What a shame, who wants to drink good bourbon out of Styrofoam. The best part was the bicycle rental kiosk on the property. The gentleman there was kind and efficient. Rental price inexpensive, bike functioned and with a basket and lock- everything you need for the 2 mile hike into town for the day.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: HS62
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this hotel for a few days combining holiday with visiting family. All the staff - without exception - were fantastic! Very friendly with nothing too much trouble. The pool area was clean and very inviting. Although away from Duval Street, taxis were inexpensive and readily available throughout the day. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “quick get away”
Reviews.Author: Billy D
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Hotel was great. Staff gretting was awesome!!!!! Pool was very nice. Price for bar was not bad id expect to be more pricey. Breakfeast was nice and once again staff was great and very helpful. They also have scooter there at hotel for rent. Even though we drove down we decided to take taxi to downtown. Range around $10. Room doors are outside. That was the downfall I did not like. Room was very clean. Tiled floor and shower. This is not your typical shower very nice!! Will def stay again. Thanks for a wonderful time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing room for a Marriott property.”
Reviews.Author: Missbrown305
Reviews.Content: We were in town for one nite at $229 for an event that our Son was participating in. The young woman at the front desk was great. Very friendly and helpful, also honored our early check in request. As we made are way through the property to our room (#226) It felt a little run down. When we entered our room I was shocked at the size. It was uncomfortably small, waaay smaller than any standard room I have ever stayed in. The two double beds took up the entire room. The bathroom had a modern glass shower that was nice but the overall size was a tiny box. I had to have my Son step out of room so I could dress because there was no room to move in the bathroom. The rooms were not soundproof at all and the a/c was very noisy but we opted to sleep with the a/c on all nite to drown out the outside noise. The overall cleanliness of the room was very good although the coffee maker had a thick layer of dust on it and came only with coffee, no sugar cream etc. There was a very nice pool area with a bar which we did visit briefly for a drink.The Bartender was very pleasant and friendly. Also, there is a very nice complimentary breakfast which had lots of options including Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches. The staff at breakfast was amazingly friendly! Overall, the staff and pool area were great, but the rooms were very disappointing for a Marriott property. I splurged on this hotel to ensure we had a comfortable room but could have gone with several nearby budget hotels and had the same or better accommodations. Won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming...Friendly Staff....Great little place.”
Reviews.Author: LORIandSTEVEOC
Reviews.Content: My daughter was very pleased with her experience at the Fairfield in Key West. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I had gifted her my points and she stayed. The hotel staff and bar staff were very friendly and accommodating. Her weekend in Key West began the moment she stepped into the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: beemer43
Reviews.Content: This is a great job by Marriott in upgrading an older property.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good service but rooms not up to Marriott standard”
Reviews.Author: cyow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a drop in and was a little shocked at the size and quality of the rooms. Marriott is my preferred chain and never disappoints... except this time. Nice friendly staff all around and good service. Nice grounds and decent pool. We did find ants around the sink in room 111 which was off putting. I wouldn't have minded sharing the room with them if we had had a bit more space. First time I have stayed at a Marriott that was so small and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff-an older Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Great staff, Joe for the morning breakfast was super, Pete the bartender in the afternoon was excellent as well along with all the other staff. They made the stay very comfortable for our family (we had 4 rooms). Nice pool and setting-obviously an older property but in fairly good shape. As a platinum elite member I have stayed in many Marriott properties-not sure about the value we paid here, never been to Key West before but seemed pricey based on other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn and Suites Key West”
Reviews.Author: steve c
Reviews.Content: great staff, great location. just a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: kknapp
Reviews.Content: Being a gold member of Marriott, this was an average property at best. This was the first time I was not recognized and thanked for my gold member status, not a deal breaker still a first in 3 years. SMALL rooms, small (not KIng) uncomfortable bed, lack of closet, noisy (thin walls and loud slamming doors) & location all added to my dislikes. The fact I used points to stay and only paid out of pocket 1/2 nights added to the value. Our room overlooked a residential neighborhood- my first experience at a Marriott property. Continental breakfast was included but the reason they supply 5 oz plastic cups to drink from escapes me. The variety of breakfast and service of the staff there must be recognized as great. We did witness, while waiting at the front desk, the attempts of 3 staff to see to the needs of a complaining customer, which can be commended. But it should have taken all 3 to assist them while other of use waited in line. There were bicycles and scooter on site to rent, which was a nice touch. We did not utilize, but chose to cab to our destination. Parking was ample and secure. Overall for the price can be seen as a value stay in KW, but not sure I would return paying high season prices without exploring other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Gjackso
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent three nights here in January, 2012, for $170 plus tax (senior rate). Obviously the hotel used to be another chain because the rooms are smaller than a typical Fairfield Inn. But it has been nicely remodeled; the pool is very attractive with beautiful landscaping; free parking The breakfast was pretty good (typical for Fairfield); it is served outside, overlooking the pool. There is no view of water (other than the pool). One of the local tour buses (Old Town Trolley) has a stop in front of the hotel, which was very convenient; unfortunately it only operated till around 5:30 PM so we had to take a taxi back from the old town area one night - $10 plus tip for two passengers. We will certainly consider this hotel the next time we are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: Lois O
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Fairfield previously and booked this trip for a retirement celebration with a family member. The staff made us feel like we were staying in a private home. They could not have been friendlier. Many staff members are from other countries but speak beauftiful english and told us charming stories of their countries. It was quite interesting. They told us they appreciated us speaking to them because it helped them learn about our country as well. Our car stayed parked at the Inn and we took local transportation to downtown Key West so we didn't have the hassle and worry of parking our car or driving in "season" traffic. The best way to travel. We could have rented bikes, but we took buses and taxis - cheap! GO! You'll love every minute!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing first time in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: Caddyshackalot
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn is the absolute best value and the staff is nothing short of fantastic. From Lyndsey and the girls at the front desk to Pete our daily bartender to the sweetest breakfast staff, they are what made our trip so memorable. Can't thank you enough for showing our family such hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 300adams
Reviews.Content: We stay at Marriotts around the world but never in Key West. So we thought that we would take a chance on this hotel. What a great find. It is located right outside the downtown noise and traffic. Easy to get to all things in "Key West". The trolley stopped right in front of the door so we coud leave our car parked. The rooms are bright and ariy and they have the most spectacular pool with a BAR right beside the pool. Having a short swim and a great tropical drink in the sun was a bonus we did not expect. Love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Key West first timer - great (staff were very nice)”
Reviews.Author: AndrewC00
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't located in the 'main strip' BUT it is within easy walking distance - a nice leisurely (and safe) walk (or if you're not inclined then a cheap taxi ride). The staff are great, even assisting in booking our day trip to Dry Tortugas (Fort Jefferson); a MUST do.

Reviews.Title: “smarter 46”
Reviews.Author: smarter46
Reviews.Content: VERY SMALL room: not up to marriott standards. Had to cahnge rooms because the ceiling was falling down, hair in the towels, and a large wad of hair in the room hair dryer. The shower had mol d spots in the ceiling and the shower tile was so slippery that it was a hazard to take a shower, must have used VERY unskilled labor as the sharp corners of the tile proturded in the shower and tile that was away from the wall and no grouted was full of gunk. Extremely disappointed in the room, although the help was very nice as was the outdoor area.

Reviews.Title: “first time in key west”
Reviews.Author: jojosis
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel..wasnt happy with the small room and was too far for my husband to walk...the front desk moved me to a better room the next day..it was perfect for us...the staff at breakfast was excelent and made us feel welcome every morning..we loved chatting with barbara danielle and joe... the only negative was the bartender pete.. he was very un sociable and we asked him for coffee at noon and he said it wouldnt be available till 5 pm..not good customer service..one nite he had 22 ppl at the bar drinking and at 650 i asked him to make a drink and he just kept looking at his watch and fussing...excuse me!! u are in the hotel biz in key west and u cant get a cocktail after 7 pm???not good buisness!!! i have to say he turned away all those people and lost much revenue for the hotel...my suggestion would be to hire a bartender who actually likes people and u will get a better response from the guests...

Reviews.Title: “First time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Bree D
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Fairfield were great to us on our trip to Key West. They were always friendly and energetic and offered us many suggestions during our stay. The King suite was up to Marriott standards, but for us, the pool, breakfast, and bar area were a huge hit. Although its location is a little ways from Duval Street, it was still within walking distance or a short cab ride. We appreciated the quiet and relaxed atmosphere that was offered. Can't wait to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Key West stay”
Reviews.Author: Rodger R
Reviews.Content: I'm retired, for 5 years I was Platinum Elite, one year over 125 nights at Marriott. Now just Gold Nice stay walking distance to most places. First visit to the Keys, didn;t know what to expect. Lots of fun. Nice Tiki bar. Rodger3205

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the action, too small for three and too motel-like for a Fairfield Inn/Marriott property.”
Reviews.Author: WellesleyDriver
Reviews.Content: I'm usually a big Marriott fan, no longer Platinum as I was when I travelled more. This sounded like a good deal, Key West for 5 days and only 100,000 points. However, this was a between semester break for our daughter and we should have been advised that the "twin double" room was way too small for three. The usual great beds were not only too small (my fault, I was told they were doubles, not Queens), but the mattresses were old and there were creaking box springs to boot. The high thread count bedding was also missing, although to be fair, the room was decorated as well as it could be for such a tiny space. The staff was excellent, but this was really an old motel. The pool and breakfast area was very nice, but we bailed out as soon as we could the first morning. This made it hard to shop for a good hotel, but we were extremely happy to find the Pier House, even though that changed the expense formula by $1,500 for our 4 remaining days in Key West. If you want to do Key West in style, there is no other option than a well located Duvall and Front St. Property. The bargains in this town aren't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not great!”
Reviews.Author: IAHboyz
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott elite, I've stayed upwards of 70 nights per year in various Marriotts. This property has a large pool, friendly staff & free continental breakfast. But, we had the A/C on in our king suite and water started dripping from the overhead duct. It left a puddle on the tile floor, so we piled towels on the floor so we wouldn't slip. We turned the air off, but it continued dripping for 2 more hrs. Sadly, this has happened at this place before! Also the sofa beds need to be updated or replaced. It sagged greatly & the mattress was compacted such that you could feel the bars on your back. The location isn't too far from town, about 2 miles, so I think they feel their location supersedes quality. Oh well. Better luck next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and beautiful pool etc.”
Reviews.Author: JLD1966
Reviews.Content: We took a 2 night 3 day vacation and stayed at the Fairfield Inn in January 2012. We travel a lot and really were impressed with how friendly the staff was and how bright and clean the property was. The pool was big with a lot of lounge chairs. This continental breakfast was amazing with so many wonderful choices . We especially enjoyed the healthy options of fresh fruit,yogurt,and hard boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love Key West”
Reviews.Author: Razon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, awesome front of house staff, average room service.

Reviews.Title: “Miranda Family, Xmas & New Year Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ralphdm
Reviews.Content: This Fairfield Inn was as good as any full service Marriott Property I have stayed at. The hotel was very clean and recently remodeled. Staff and management were very professional, friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was the BEST I have ever had at any hotel!! It was complete with fruit, bagels, oatmeal, biscuits, yogurt...and more! There is also a beautiful pool, bar, workout room, free wifi, as well as a businees center with two computers hooked to printers.The only draw back it is about a mile from Duval St.and we did not have a mini fridge in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience”
Reviews.Author: Alantolley
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is old, the reception area is good, the pool area very good, but the rooms are awful, we stayed in room 118, the tv remote did not work (ok you can live with that), the air con did not work on auto so had to be on all the time to keep the room at a comfortbale temperature, the drains had a problem in the shower, when you took a shower there was a terrible sewarage smell, the room was small and shabby, but on a positive side the bedding and towels were clean. I did complain about the room at reception and they apologised and we were only staying the one night.

Reviews.Title: “I love Marriott”
Reviews.Author: EmersonT
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast. Didn't swim but very nice pool. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great people,”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelsAlberta
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Fairfield Inn, we had a king suite which was perfect. Overlooking the pool area is great however make sure your room doesnt back onto the main street. Either the management has to insulate better or create some kind of sound barrier. Also, don't expect water pressure in the shower. Apparently, that's a Key West thing. They did try to replace the shower head. To no avail. However, they did try to make it up to us when we commented. Great service overall. Lots of friendly staff. Room was spacious, clean and had two tv/s as well as a fold out. Breakfast included was good for the start of the day. Two miles to walk to centre of the everything. Easy walking and safe. Overall, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awww comfort in Paridise!!”
Reviews.Author: AngryBirdMSP
Reviews.Content: Just left the hotel about 10 hours ago!! Great place away from Duval and craziness!! But not comfort, great bed, Great Pool. The staff is awesome!! Would stay again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service! Nice room for the money - very clean!”
Reviews.Author: TXDaycationer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did not know what to expect as we had not been to Key West before. This hotel was the cheapest of the chains hotels and we really weren't sure about the accomodations. We were greated by smiling, friendly staff - including the hotel manager - who immediately gave us a drink and mardi gras beads. We found that we had been upgraded to a suite - it was pretty sweet! The pool is georgeous with fountains spraying into the pool (which is heated :o) it made a swim perfect as it was a little chilly out). The room was very nice for the price. These are not 5 star accomodations, but they are the best for the price that you pay. We were able to park under the lights both nights we were there. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, fairly basic for Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: pickyreno
Reviews.Content: Being a Platinum Rewards member gets you 200 points at checkin, and that is it. We just came from Doral to visit for a few days in Key West, the other Marriotts here were sold out... courtyard and beachside. The reviews from earlier on the location and staff had me optimistic that there might be bright lights. Yes, the staff are welcoming. No upgrades here due to high occupancy in winter. Basic rooms, no frills. Bring your own soaps n shampoo is you are expecting high end products. This is not the Napa Fairfield if you have ben there, you know what I mean. No no, this is much more basic. We paid $187/night, free parking, free wifi, second floor in building with no elevators, view of pool king bed and pull out sofa. No patio. Free breakfast, Marriott inn usual. Sink could use renovation. Glass shower with tile. Atleast tv was flat panel. Sofa needs to be thrown out. Mattress needs to be replaced. It is a basic fairfield inn. The price is standard for winter in Key west. There is laundry and bike rentals on site. The staff here try their best to do what thy can with what there is. If you need perks and newer accomodations, this is not it. It is the Keys, go have a drink and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Property, met expectactions!”
Reviews.Author: Meljadeb
Reviews.Content: Had a decent and comfortable stay. Accommodation was booked via Loyalty Points, BONUS! All amenities were good. Check-in/out was efficient. Rooms were of a good size and were well maintained. Bathroom was tidy. Parking was simple. Staff were very pleasant. The staff attending breakfast were helpful and polite. Pool was fun! Wifi - thank you!!! Breakfast had a good selection and healthy choices (fruits, yoghurt etc). Location - 10 minute drive to most of the action. However this was a positive when it came to sleep time. It was generally a quiet stay. It is exactly what you would expect from a Fairfield Inn Property, except it comes with Roosters!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: The service is VERY good. Everybody is so incredibly nice and friendly. The pool was beautiful. The air conditioning works very well..

Reviews.Title: “Standard Fairfield Inn Experience - but Good Spot in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Q R
Reviews.Content: Good location (a bit outside the main area but close enough to do all you want during the visit). Hotel is a standard Fairfield Inn. Nice swimming pool area - can be a bit too many family/kids. The parking became quite a bit of a problem on a few of the nights during our stay. Overall, an average hotel and a standard expected Fairfield Inn. Little to no extra perks afforded - even for a higher level (Platinum Level) Marriott Rewards holder.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed - Small Rooms, Lousy Beds”
Reviews.Author: lvmylabrador
Reviews.Content: Nice Lobby, staff was nice but not overly friendly. I wasnâ€™t impressed with the rooms. The rooms were small, two double beds, and tile floors. You get to your room from the outside. The first floor is a second floor to me. You have to go up a flight of stairs to get to the first floor. They have an elevator which wasnâ€™t working when we checked in. You can hear people walking and talking as they walked by your room. The person above us had on heals of some sort on. You could hear them walking back and forth in their room. The street noise was pretty load listening to the cars and trucks pass by. The beds were very uncomfortable. You could hear the springs squeak when you moved. The bathroom looked like it was remodeled. There was a stand up shower with all glass. The toilet wasnâ€™t upgraded though. The Breakfast area was located outside by the pool. There wasnâ€™t any indoor seating. The pool was fairly large. There wasnâ€™t a hot tub. This hotel is not located anywhere near Duval Street. You have to get a taxi or take the bus. Taxi is $4 a person to get to this hotel from Duval Street and vice versa. The bus is normally $2 a person but it was free during 21 â€“ 24 December. Of course it didnâ€™t come as often and was occasionally very late. The bus stop is located down the street and across the street. You have to cross a busy street no cross walk. Overall I was not impressed with the rooms at this hotel, I think itâ€™s basically a dumb with a good pool area.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: RAlsulaimani
Reviews.Content: hi i spent 2 night at this property in the largest suite, the space is good with freg, microwave 2 tv, i believe its great value for family. the breakfast is ok ( boiled egg, flakes..) nothing fancy... so bottom line if you want a budget friendly place go there but if you are looking for some luxury even 2% you are in the wrong place

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: cartog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location in early December 2011 for 4 nights. This was my second stay at this hotel. I was greeted warmly in the lobby and the staff did notice I had stayed there before. They expressed their appreciation for again staying with them. Since I had arrived early, my king suite room was not quite ready. This was no problem as they took my cell phone number and indicated that they would call me when my room was available. In the mean time, I found a park next to the East Martello Fort and Museum to eat my picnic lunch. The king suite was very clean, with tile floors, shower with no tub, comfortable bed, balcony overlooking a nice pool, and the air conditioning was quiet and efficient. I did like the clean tile floors rather than the rather drab dirty carpet found in a lot of hotels. The hotel provides a nice breakfast outside near the pool area. A minor negative with the suite was that there was hardly any shelving or drawer space for storage. The hotel does have a couple of computers available in the lobby area for use by guests. The hotel is about two miles from Old Town so you need to be aware of that. Bicycle rental is available by an outside company that has a location at the hotel. I found their bicycles to be all purple girl's bikes of sub-par quality. One of these bikes would be OK for one day, but not for the 3 days that I would use it. So, I rented a bike from The Bike Shop which is located near Truman and White streets. The price was $12 day for a Trek beach cruiser. A lock and light were provided. I look forward to staying at this hotel on my next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool”
Reviews.Author: Runnermom3
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Key West, stay here! Great pool area and breakfast area. The breakfast area is all open and around the pool area. Beautiful pool area! Plenty of chairs to lay around in and the pool is large enough so you have plenty of room even with a large number of guests. Rooms are very, very small and have very minimal decor/furnishings (the only negative) but the pool area makes this hotel worth it. We have stayed here several times. Only had one bad experience and that was because it was biker week. Since the parking is directly under the rooms, it was Very loud espcially from 12-3 am. We are just more cautious about when we go to the Keys! We will stay at this location every visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convient and nice”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! The Trolly stops in the parking lot, so you can get a ticket from the front desk and it's good for 2 days! Beats a taxi! Wished they would have told us that when we were asking how to get around day one, but we figured it out later and made the best of it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: The people are so friendly and The Fairfield Inn was really, really nice. Beautiful pool. Breakfast at the pool in the morning was wonderful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All top notch + mopeds”
Reviews.Author: real_name_not
Reviews.Content: warm welcome;great poolside bar, great pool;nice room, clean everything; nice free breakfst buffett poolside; and the bonus not expected? They have Moped rental at the activity desk, and Mopeds on hand and ready to go. We got 2 and they were nice, new, and pretty reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: WeThreeAdventurers
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel one night. We did some diving in Key Largo and decided to do one night in Key West. The hotel is easy to find. We had a rental car, so its location was great...just a quick drive to see a sunset or go to Duval St. They also have free parking...which I think is rare from when I did my search for a place to stay. Friendly staff at check in. The room was clean. We had a King Studio, so we had plenty of room. The shower was a stall shower only...and plenty of hot water! They did offer free breakfast, but we did not get the chance to use it. I had read other reviews noting the street side being noisy...we had a pool facing room and had no issues with outside noise. If we make it back to Key West, we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Get Away”
Reviews.Author: bim55
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a perfect location for a fun weekend in Key West. The room layouts were unique, spacious and clean. The pool area provided a quiet nice hide away for the morning after the night on the town. This hotel was a quick 5 minute, or $4/person cab ride to Duval St. and dozens of restaurants and pubs. Close to everything, but not a walk to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and comfortable visit”
Reviews.Author: 807wheaton
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our two night stay. The lobby and check in area is modern and we were welcomed warmly. Our room was ready when we got there so we had a quick check in. We had a room that overlooked the pool. The rooms all have outside entries and the interior is small but upbeat and clean. The pool is very lovely day or night. We felt perfectly safe here. The staff was very friendly and checked quite often if we needed anything and asked how everything was. Even though the room is small, the bathroom is completely renovated with appealing tile surfaces. There were plenty of towels, hand and bath soap, shampoo and conditioner. There was always plenty of ice. All lights worked and airconditioning was fine. Breakfast was served at 6:30 which was nice; because it is so warm here the breakfast area is outside on decks which overlook the pool. They had the same menu both mornings we were there. Boiled eggs, bagels, assortment of sweet rolls, juices, coffee, tea, milk,cold and hot cereals, yogurt and waffles. A big bowl of oranges and apples sat out each morning. The location of this place is about a mile from the historic downtown. It is located on busy Roosevelt Avenue. The big problem in Key West is parking. There are two parking decks in the historic area and lots of parking meters which take one quarter for each ten minutes, so it's $1.50 an hour to park. The meters also take credit cards. There are a few all day $10 parking lots. However, we did locate a free parking area by The Hemmingway House. We went the first week in November which is a relatively low tourist time. Even so, there were a lot of people there and parking was difficult to find. The trolley stops at this Fairfield Inn, and it costs $29 for an all day off and on. Definitely the large pool is the crowning characteristic of this hotel. We paid $110 a night with a Senior's rate, so it was a nice place for a reasonable price in a high tourist area. Before we left, we went over to the "beach" side of Key West and discovered it is completely different from the busy area where we stayed. There is a nice beach with an uncrowded street with a wide sidewalk for bicycling. There is a much more tropical feel and look on this side. We will try this the next time we visit the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Small tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Darlene B
Reviews.Content: Rooms so tiny you cannot pass one another inside the room - no place to put your luggage except on top of the bed or step over it. Front desk staff gave the impression of hating their jobs...

Reviews.Title: “Not really worthy of the marriott brand”
Reviews.Author: soumnaik
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I am currently in a room in the hotel. Too much road noise and the loud AC have kept me awake so far. 1st impression was not good - even my 6 year old commented that the hotel looked like a red roof inn. 1st room got flooded - was shifted to another room. I am not impressed with this hotel at all. For the money that I paid (160$), I have stayed in far better marriotts in the past. My outlook of marriott has now changed and I will need to be very careful when I select a marriott in the future. I hope that the Sales Manager reads this review and offers me a nice complimentary something to make up for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: lovethekeys22121
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel Nov 4-6th and had no problems. From the time I walked into the Lobby (greeted with a cup of juice) to the time of checkout the staff was friendly, helpful and always smiling. The continental breakfasts here were wonderful. Huge variety of choices and fresh selections. Pool area was great for our family (traveling with 5 year old and 2 year old). Room was huge but it was big enough and very clean and comfortable. We had a room away from the street so I can't complain about noise. Honestly for the money this was a fantastic hotel and would definitely recommend and choose it again in the future. If you are looking to be on Duval street you need to drive or taxi cab. However, we had children so it wasn't our top priority to stay out late and be in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but on the Road”
Reviews.Author: JuloJulo
Reviews.Content: Good Value but pool bar at the evening is closed. Font undestand. Poor breakfast for Europeans. No vegetables everything sweet And bad coffe but this is almost everywher in USA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great pool area for a Fairfield.”
Reviews.Author: spdst13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend using points. It's the closet of the Marriott hotels to Duval street at about 2 miles away. This hotel does not offer a free shuttle like the other Marriott properties, although it's only about a $10 cab ride down to Duval St. However, it does have a free continental breakfast. The hotel is on N Roosevelt Blvd, which is one of the main roads on the island. The area that it is in is a very commercial area (fast food restaurants, car dealerships, strip malls) but it seems like that is true for most of the chain hotels in Key West. We had a room with two doubles, facing the pool. All rooms appeared to have exterior entrances on the pool side and none appeared to have a personal balcony, just the exterior walkways. The appearance of the room was nice and modern, but the doubles are somewhat small, suites are certainly better. As with all Marriott hotels, the rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly. The nicest thing about this hotel was its pool area. It was much nicer than I would expect for a Fairfield Inn. There was also an outdoor bar by the pool, I think it stayed open til 7pm. There were a few food/snack options at the bar, but it was mostly there for drinks. If I have the opportunity to stay in Key West again, I would certainly consider this hotel. However, I would likely choose the Courtyard for the free shuttle and slightly nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Roadnut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two weeknights during the Fantasy Fest celebration. The woman at the check-in desk was welcoming, and even "cute" in a way - she warned us that the fest was going on, just in case we weren't aware of it! (We were well aware of it though.) Check in was otherwise fast and she answered all of our questions. Rates for our stay were reasonable, considering the event that was going on at the time. The room itself (208) had a king-sized bed. The room is a little small but otherwise decently sized for 2 people to move around. Air conditioner was loud but worked very well. TV was excellent. Shower stall is very large. Only main problem with the room was the tiling around the shower drain was sharp in one or two spots - we put a washcloth down for protection. Only other problem was when we tried asking a maid to come into our room for something; we were unable to communicate to her in any way that we wanted her to stop by! (We mentioned the minor issue to the front desk as we left) Taxi fare from the hotel to Duval Street was about $12, including tip. We called the front desk to ask them to get a taxi for us. They said 5 - 10 minutes but they yielded a taxi very quickly - under 5 minutes both times. Parking is free and about 1/2 the spots are covered (under the hotel). Breakfast buffet was delicious with very helpful and pleasant staff. Waffle makers are a little finicky though. Pool and grounds were inviting. Plenty of USA Today's to read. Only item on my wish-list here would be to add a Checkout option to the menu options on the screen.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Key West Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tagk0
Reviews.Content: I've been at all three of the Key West Marriott Hotels and this is my favorite for value and relaxation. Has a great relaxing pool layout, full continental+ breakfast and on this last visit a staff which worked harder than most travel agents finding some last minute activities and making the bookings for our family.

Reviews.Title: “really very nice”
Reviews.Author: NYer12
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but very nicely appointed. The hotel itself was very attractive and the staff was welcoming and helpful. Sitting by the pool with its tropical garden, relaxing while having breakfast or an evening drink was great. The location was good and the price reasonable for Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaSD
Reviews.Content: I travel to Key West regularly for work and always stay at the Fairfield Inn. It's a great hotel....good location, decent-sized rooms, delicious breakfast and an amazing staff. Nick, the sales manager, always tries to get me the best rates. In addition, everyone at the front desk is always helpful and there to greet you with a smile, especially Beata - she is extremely helpful and was able to quickly resolve booking issues i had the last time i checked-in. I totally recommend this hotel when you are in Key West either for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Good value during your stay at Key West”
Reviews.Author: TravelTravelNow
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for somewhere to stay at Key West, you'll probably experience sticker shock. I never found anything "cheap" that looked appealing enough for me to stay in it. The Fairfield was by far the best value. It has free parking (a big deal in Key West), an awesome pool, and the best free continental breakfast I've ever seen. The staff is extremely friendly as well. The rooms are small but appear recently redone, and I loved the tiled shower. The hotel is a short drive from all the main attractions in Key West, I believe one of the trolley companies also picks up in the parking lot. This is a great value and nice place to stay during your trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn - Key West”
Reviews.Author: Eric G
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, nice and quite. Our room was small but even with that, the room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel pool was very nice - I don't think I have ever seen a Fairfield Inn with a pool that large and fancy. The free breakfast was excellent and a great bargin. Also, the staff was outstanding... very friendly and helpful with everything (from check-in to local sights). We would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: keith m
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at your Key West location. The staff was superb especially Olivia who provided the absolute best locations on the island to have great food and drink. This included helping us with reservations on a sunset cruise that we will remember for a life time. This was a long awaited vacation and even with the rain we had for the first 4 days we had an excellent time with the help of your friendly and curteous staff. They kept us smiling throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient, Noisy, and Credit Block.”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: After we checked in we went to rent scooters from the onsite rental agent (separate business from the hotel). When we went to pay for the deposit on the scooter, to our amazement, our Debit card was declined. This only happens when our spending limit is increased for the day or more obvious we are out of money. Neither of these should have been the case because our room was prepaid months ago. So we had to pay $200 in cash for the deposit on the scooter. Upon further investigation the hotel mistaking charged us again for the hotel stay. We informed them of their error and they said they would credit the card. The problem is now our card is locked and we are left only with cash. I spent an outrageous amount of time talking to both the Hotel and my bank to clear up this error. It was not the way I wanted to spend the first day of my vacation. I talked to 4-5 people at the hotel and 2-3 people at my bank before it was finally resolved. VERY AGGRAVATING. 6 HOUR ORDEAL. The other very aggravating issue was the location of the ice machine. There is only one for the entire complex. It is located in the far back corner above the parking garage. It can only be accessed by stairs unless you are lucky enough to be located on the far wing of the complex. It's mind boggling that the Marriott would have only one ice machine for a complex of this size. The Hotel is located on a very busy, fast moving street that is noisy all time of the day and night. The pool area is very nice and large with several water features. The bar is located very close and is also nice. The shower was large and had very good water pressure. The hot water was nice and hot. Only one mirror in the room. This became a major inconvenience when we tried to get ready go in the A.M and P.M. The grounds were clean and well maintained. I would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “two nice days at key west”
Reviews.Author: Vecchio59
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, comfortable rooms and nice pool. people is very warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Trvlvr
Reviews.Content: Only stayed there one night but nothing to complain about. Bed was comfortable, linens were soft. Bartender at pool bar poured 'generously'. And the manager gave us an extra free drink coupon. Pool was clean. Didn't eat the free breakfast but it looked well stocked an clean. Absolutely no compliants for this one!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and beautiful bathroom!!!”
Reviews.Author: Xrodriguez29
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Key West for our 6 yr anniversary chose the fairfield had great rates. We were not disappointed at all..Room are clean and bathroom is very nice and clean.Good breakfast buffet the pool view is beautiful also the staff very pleasant.We enjoyed our short stay here we do recommend!!:)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Marejse
Reviews.Content: Rooms nothing special; not very spacious and "weird" bathroom. Nice breakfast buffet with a lot of different choices (only one type of tea, though). Good location. Friendly staff. We asked for a quiet room when booking online and we probably got the most quiet room at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to unwind and relax!”
Reviews.Author: EllenPiek
Reviews.Content: I really liked the suites and thought the staff was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “A weekend in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Dick L
Reviews.Content: Was placed in a room to accomodate a handicap person. My profile with Marriott does not request this so I was disappointed. Great pool area and bar and the staff was exceptionally friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and property - GREAT Pool!”
Reviews.Author: HLC916
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Key West for a wedding and chose the Fairfield because it carries the Marriott name and had a great rate. We were not disappointed! The rooms were clean, comfortable and the beds ideal for a good night's sleep. The grounds and pool area were extremely clean and well kept. The pool is fantastic and being able to enjoy a complimentary breakfast out there each morning was wonderful. They have a special server named Mirella who took great care of us every day we were there! She is one of the best service industry employees I have encountered in a long time!! The hotel ia close enough to downtown Key West, but without the noise or crowds. It's a quick drive to Duval, where you can find whatever you might want to do. Overall, property was a great value for the price! A few negatives (which were greatly outweighed by positives): Rooms do not have mini-refrigerators (bring a cooler!); the doors are heavy, hurricane style and slam loudly; and on the back side of the building lives a rooster who will let you know when it's dawn. (If your A/C is on, you probably won't ever hear him though.)

Reviews.Title: “Key West visit”
Reviews.Author: IT2910
Reviews.Content: Really nice place. Nice relaxing pool area, and bar area. The staff were really friendly. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: us1087
Reviews.Content: You know what you are getting when you book a Fairfield over a Courtyard or Marriott. The towels are a bit thinner, the breakfast is a bit cheaper, the rooms are a bit smaller. This Fairfield is a tale of two hotels. The newer main building and the older "buildings that time forgot". I was lucky to stay in the new building this time after staying in the old building last time. I stayed one night for business and have average reviews each time. The bathroom had bugs, the sliding door did not close and bearly locked, the lock on the front door looks like it has been broken into. The other two Marriott properties on the island offer a shuttle to Duval St. It would be nice if they could pair up and offer something similar. The pool is nice. The staff is friendly. The breakfast is outside (enclosed but on a patio area) is great except when it rains (which it tends to do in Florida in the summer). The wireless is pretty good. If you need a place to lay your head for a night, this place will do. If you are looking for a resort vacation, this is not the best spot.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality done right!”
Reviews.Author: magsmolsmocs
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond making our vacation one of the best! Hats of to the General Manager and his staff. Keep up the great work

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: The_Producer
Reviews.Content: If you book rooms at name brand hotels because you don't want surprises when you arrive, look somewhere else. Although the main building appears to be relatively new construction - as you might expect if you've stayed in Fairfield Inns in the past - most of the rooms here are in much older buildings that had obviously been built long before Marriott took over. Although the room was clean, it was extremely small and not very well appointed. The pool area was nice but the parking area (most of it under the guest rooms on the exposed first floor) filled up quickly. Everything had a new coat of paint, but the place just had a tired, run-down feel to it. I will say, the staff were wonderful and because of them I have to give the hotel an overall "Average" rating. If this hotel was on a small Caribbean island it would be a gem, but in Key West I think I could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be more handicap accessible...”
Reviews.Author: LisaNJeremy
Reviews.Content: This hotel had one handicap parking spot out front, and only one entrance with a ramp to the rooms/pool area. To make someone in a wheelchair go from one end of the resort to another in order to reach a ramp is just not acceptable these days. I paid $60 more at this hotel than my hotel on Duval Street which offered an amazing cooked to order breakfast and great accessibility. The breakfast was far from good at Fairfield, and the workers were annoying trying to sell excurisions. I will definitely plan in advance to not have to stay with Fairfield again.

Reviews.Title: “would not return”
Reviews.Author: Bon4417
Reviews.Content: We were not happy with this hotel, somehow the pictures online were not the same as this hotel.Seemed antiquated and the bath countertop was open into the bedroom and a curtain halfway??????? I expected more from this room considering it was a Farifield Inn. The staff were very nice, but instead of the week, we stayed one night. Glad to be out of there. Maybe it is great for young people who don't mind sharing the openess of the room with no privacy.............

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Linda462009
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. We will definitely recommend the Fairfield Inn to our friends and family members.

Reviews.Title: “Love the staff not the room”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn P
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and not very clean we had mold in our room. The staff, pool and breakfast included was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTerryberry
Reviews.Content: Our previous hotel offering was a serious disappointment. I booked this in a pinch. Arrived about a half hour after booking. They had all my info ready to go. Check in took all of 3 minutes. The girls were very friendly. Our room was over top of where we parked which was great because we were on a motorcycle. Our room was spotless! A/C was set so the room was cool and comfortable when walking in and not a wall of hot stale air. Bathroom was immaculate as was toilet and sink. Bed was comfortable. Linens were clean. Hotel staff was good about calling a taxi for us. Continental breakfast was okay in the mornings. Could have been better but hey, it was no extra charge! Scooter rental guy was a doll. Gave us a deal and we saved about $70 on two scooters for 8 hours. Gave a complete demonstration about operation of the scooters. Pool area was awesome! Lots of seating areas, chairs, towels, etc. Pool was clean. Pool cleaner guy was there at night taking care of pool. Bar was ok. Drinks were over priced....small plastic cup size frozen drink approx 8oz was $8.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: TracyC34369
Reviews.Content: As most reviews for this hotel were positive, I was really looking forward to my stay here. However, was sorely disappointed upon arrival. The room was very basic, with a very small vanity area and we didn't even find the blow dryer until the second day, as they had it hung out of site in a bag. And the beds were average. To get ice you had to take your ice bucket to the bar for them to fill it for you. What? And lets not even talk about the noisy air conditioner! The room only had a small refrigerator and no microwave. The pool was nice, although quite cold, even for me as a native Floridian. And the bartender at the poolside bar could really use a lesson in hospitality. The breakfast wasn't bad with several healthy choices. The one bright point of our stay was the greeter that was there when we arrived at the hotel. She was the best! So cheerful and friendly! If it weren't for her, this place would get a 0 out of 10. Needs a lot or improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: itsgabby
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Key West with my family and as soon as I get to the hotel it was terrible. The bathroom smelled like sewer water, the front door couldn't open wider, it felt like we were in a motel. Why would marriott make this kind of hotel but it really is not a hotel it's a motel. I don't recamand this hotel (motel).

Reviews.Title: “Splurge and get king suite”
Reviews.Author: Ray L
Reviews.Content: My wife, 9 YO daughter and I stayed 6 nights in August and had a great time in the Keys. The large pool is what sold us on this property and I am glad we upgraded to the king suite. The one we had was on second floor overlooking the pool, directly above tiki bar and was a perfect spot. Rooms facing Hwy 1 are exposed to much road noise and I could keep an eye on my daughter in pool from large balcony with chairs and table. Front desk personell very helpful, especially Olivia. Breakfast buffett was good, servicing personnel were very friendly. Other guests (mostly foreign) were very pushy and do not seem to respect one's personal space. I had to get very firm with more than one as I made waffles (you'd think they never had waffles before as they were nearly fighting over the batter!). Anyhow, the room was nice and neat. The only improvements is I wish there were drawers for clothes. None whatsoever and there is dead wall space to place dresser drawers. They ar blanked off with painted panelling! AC could have been cooler and the previous guests had dumped an ashtray over balcony onto metal roof and the stench was real bad when sitting on balcony. I requested to front desk it be cleaned but it never was and I ended up rinsing the roof off myself with ice bucket to remove old butts (about 20). On a 1-10, I would rate it a 6.5. At 180/nite I would expect a bit better and would consider staying here again but will shop around first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great service but loud roosters!”
Reviews.Author: AlliePen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off a busy street and has a trolley stop there. That was convient during our stay. I don't consider it within walking distance of old town so, I'd suggest bringing money for cabs. The room was small, but clean and everything we needed. The pool area was AWESOME and there was a poolside bar that had friendly staff. The drinks were way overpriced though. The breakfast was pretty good. The thing I that I really noticed was the great service at this hotel. The staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The only negative was that our room faced the rear parking lot and behind this parking lot were some houses that had feral roosters wandering around. They cock-a-doodle-dooed all morning long starting at like, 5:00. Which is the time I normally get up for work. However, when on vacation and staying up late at the bars, I want to sleep in a little!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl1025
Reviews.Content: My daughters were going on a cruise from Miami with family friends and we drove to Key West from Miami before the cruise. We were greeted pleasantly upon entering the hotel. We stayed in a king suite and there was plenty of room for four adults. We traveled with two teenage daughters 18 and 19. The staff was extremely friendly and efficient. I called for extra towels and wash clothes and they responded immediately. I asked for a place to buy sunscreen because I had forgotten mine and I was given several selections to choose from sunscreen that had been left behind. The staff person said that she keeps it for guests to use. Our room overlooked the pool area, which was very nice. The breakfast was very filling and the only other meal we needed was dinner. I really can't say enough about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Our family really enjoyed the vacation. My daughters liked the property also which is saying a lot because we usually stay in two bedroom condos with more space, but we waited too late and none were available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: RelayMaryAnn
Reviews.Content: We rented a lovely villa at MM 15 for a week and extended our stay an additional night at the Fairfield in Key West. Upon checkin, we were greeted with a delicious tropical drink sample and beads around our necks. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was on the second floor in the back. It was very small but clean. We did not spend much time in the room and were only there for one night but it would have been claustrophobic had we been there for a longer stay. The pool area was lovely. We went to the tiki bar around 7 PM but were unable to get a beverage because they were closing. The air conditioning in the room was very loud overnight but we were tired so it did not bother us. The breakfast buffet was very good and the staff was amazing - so friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and pool, bad rooms with ants that need updating”
Reviews.Author: Sweetsatisfaction
Reviews.Content: Not up to Marriott standards! Went for a two day trip to the Keys while in Miami on vacation. Rooms need to be updated, but the breakfast and pool areas are nice. While brushing teeth in the morning we had ants crawling out of the drain and across the sink. Our daughters were grossed out and will never go back. Also, around 4am the drunks came back from downtown and were extremely loud and looking to party more in the rooms. The front desk took care of the issue after a call. Great staff that is helpful and nice to deal with. Overall would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Domar2
Reviews.Content: The staff should be taken out and treated a dinner for doing and being so accompanying. Thanks for the great stay. Charles j. Fontenot

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katja83
Reviews.Content: Good price for ***-hotel. Breakfast was great and breakfast place was outside on terrace. Very big pool. Staff was very friendly, espicially Mirella! She came to talk to us every morning and she was always smiling! Room small and clean. Good shower. There wasn't refrigerator. We rented bycycles from the hotel for good price. We walked two times to downtown, it was just about 2,5kilometres. Not too far for us. I really recommed this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: say24hey
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was wonderful, including the breakfast, the pool, the staff, the bed and the room itself. The only complaint I had was with the A/C unit. It sounded like a freight train was in the room, and since I am not a sound sleeper, this was a negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a basic need hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Virgo823
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel that will satisfy your basic needs, clean rooms, decent price, nice look. But, if you are looking for something luxurious, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: AtlLoriMac
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, the hotel is beautiful and the staff was wonderful. The pool is absolutely beautiful and the breakfast was the best we have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a pleasure to stay here, has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: TheKatzMeow
Reviews.Content: Over the last couple years the maintenance and cleaning crew has been slacking. The pool area used to be pristine, now the paver stones are dirty and downright ugly. The landscaping is not being maintained. It is overgrown is some places, dead in others. The outside of the buildings have mold and mildew on them. It needs a good cleaning, which in FL all buildings require a couple times per year. It is a smoke free hotel, but guests tend to sneak smokes in stairwells and in the under building parking, staff does not police this. The interior of the rooms is getting worn down, need a remodel. Overall they keep them up fairly well, some mold and mildew in the shower stalls, the floors are clean, as well as the bathroom counters, sink and toilets. Towels have gotten downright cheap, used to be thin, now they are almost see through. The free breakfast is a plus, especially the staff that works to provide it, they are always helpful and keep the area as clean as they can.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Fairfield Inn, not a Renaissance...temper your expectations.”
Reviews.Author: uf1990
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this Marriott property several times. Living relative close in Central Florida we take at least one annual trip to Key West. Reading some of the negative reviews, you'd think some people were expecting to stay at the Waldorf or Ritz-Carlton. It's a FAIRFIELD INN people, and relative to other Fairfield Inn's I've stayed at, this one is a cut above. Were you expecting a Fairfield Inn to be directly on the beach...in Key West of all places where the beaches are somewhat limited? Were you expecting a special continental breakfast for lactose intolerant guests? Give me a break. This property is a Category 5 because of its location, and I feel that rating is more than warranted. The rooms are small, but you have the option of staying in a suite, hence the name Fairfield Inn and SUITES. I got married at the Pier House in Key West, and several family members stayed at the Fairfield Inn and had a great experience. They loved the tropical pool, continental breakfast and tiki bar. My wife and I will be back next month for a 4-night stay at this property. If you prefer resort style accomodations and amenities, stay somewhere. If you're used to staying at Fairfield Inn-type properties, you'll be more than pleased with this one.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Last Minute Value without a View.”
Reviews.Author: JennahBienSur
Reviews.Content: After 6 hours of Snorkeling and Sailing, this hotel had the nicest shower for a budget hotel, hands down. Great deals offered by Fury Watersports in the lobby: they're worth every penny. A lovely breakfast is included every morning poolside, but make sure you rent at least a scooter at the hotel or call a cab for casual dinners or jaunts onto Duval street if you don't have a car. When you're starving the 2 mile walk from this mainly residential area is agonizing.

Reviews.Title: “The trip was terrific!”
Reviews.Author: jjc001
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the entire staff made us feel very welcome. Great start to the vacation. The staff was very accomidating. A business is very well served by having a staff that provides such a high level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: DNL2231
Reviews.Content: I love the laid back feel of the Keys! I have stayed in this hotel once before and loved it. So when I decided to plan a friends get together, I thought that the Fairfield in Key West was perfect. The staff is so hospitable, and the hotel was very reasonably priced and a good location. We had a good time at the pool and the bar is great. Everything was perfect, especially the yummy breakfast...I can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time there and we love it!”
Reviews.Author: Floridamom55
Reviews.Content: Loved the tropical pool area. Made it feel like a tropical vacation rather than a stay in an inexpensive motel. Close enough to all the action but much less expensive than the big resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Personnel showed great helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: Mark_1298
Reviews.Content: We made a booking error but nevertheless the staff showed big empathy and they were very sensitive, helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not fancy but in a good location for Key West fun. Staff was very helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: swilletts
Reviews.Content: Two improvements need to be made; the workout room is not adequate (Cardio equipment is old and in bad shape and the weight machine was not working) and the electronics in the rooms are old and need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation to KeyWest”
Reviews.Author: sh1969
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairfield Inn in Key West was a very pleasant one. All of the attendants were so friendly and helpful. It was unfortunate that our stay could not have been longer, maybe next time and I certainly would consider staying at the Fairfield again. Thank you, Cheryl Hille

Reviews.Title: “Short 3 day July 4th get away"”
Reviews.Author: yelybn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very key west cute, unpretentious, but still had a feeling of a chain hotel and not a bed and breakfast. Out check in was the fastest we've ever had. Our room was ready at 1:00 PM and the check in is not until 3:00. The girls at the front desk welcomed us with bead necklaces and a little smoothie. My daughter loved that!. The pool was impeccable, the room was clean and had all the amenities we had requested. The bed (king) was really comfortable the sofa bed was also comfortable and both very clean. Although the room was bit noise on Sunday (the hotel is very close to the road and there is medical center near by) But hey, we were so tired at night that frankly this was not a big deal!. The breakfast was also very good nice Waffles..We had a great time and since we travel with a young child, we will be staying there again on our next Key west trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: wi_mark_1
Reviews.Content: We were greeted warmly with a virgin version of the Tiki bar's drink of the day. When we got to our room (slow, warm elevator) we could barely maneuver our luggage and bodies. Shower stall instead of bathtub is nice. Our A/C wasn't noisy, but other rooms reportedly had very noisy A/C. Rooms updated nicely, but still tiny - as small as a cruise ship stateroom. Breakfast was good, but waffle machines didn't work due to no spray. Recommend - yes, with reservations due to room size and noisy A/C.

Reviews.Title: “we loved, this was our second time and for sure we will retur next year”
Reviews.Author: mgogarcia
Reviews.Content: I like if the rooms has a mini-refrigetaror inside, the rest of every thing is great, keep going forward

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT”
Reviews.Author: halfpint0407
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, very nice and helpfull. There were there for us. I will tell everyone about this hotel. Thank You very Much. Cyndi

Reviews.Title: “I would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Euroflair
Reviews.Content: When I called Fairfield Inn I was told the hotel was situated at the beach but in fact it was a mile away - very disappointing. Had I known that in advance I wouldnâ€™t have booked it. My second disappointment was the poor breakfast selection. Third - no gift shop. Fourth - unpleasant bike/scooter rental service. And finally, some of the stuff members were overly attentive. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice and not too far from town.”
Reviews.Author: Straightup123
Reviews.Content: This place has clean, well maintained small rooms and a fabulous pool. They have a decent free breakfast each morning too. Unless you like a good 40 minute walk downtown you probably want to drive or get a cab to Duval or the marina. We did the walk and it wasn't bad at all; even in the heat. This is a solid choice and I would definitely go back again. Nothing fancy, but clean, and a great pool. What else do you need in Key West?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly "Key West" service oriented staff!”
Reviews.Author: Wickniley
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at this hotel. Not close to all the action, but the hotel staff and pool made it a great place to stay! Room layout was a little different, but overall great hotel! Would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “In a hurry to return”
Reviews.Author: retire2012
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with refreshments and big smiles from the staff. Throughout our visit, the staff was very attentive and very friendly. Breakfast bar was fantastic. The drive from the hotel to Mallory Square and Duval Street was about 5-7 minutes. Bicycle and/or scooter rental was available from the hotel. Rooms were nice and clean.
