Had a problem with the air conditioner, but service technician was there to correct problem within 5 minutes of calling the front desk. Couldn't ask for any better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rlamp12
Reviews.Content: The staff was very Friendly and helpful. They had some good info for our sightseeing. The room was very clean. It was a little small but ok for our needs. The A/C was a little noisey but you get used to it. I would reccomend this place to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SusanS34116
Reviews.Content: Parking at the hotel is no problem and free. They offer bike rental at the hotel but upon gaining an appreciation for the location in comparison to where we wanted to be - the main tourist attractions, we decided it was too dangerous to try to ride down to the old town - we ended up paying to park close to everything and then rented bikes down there for a day - all adults might be fine renting bikes from the hotel but we had children in tow and felt it too dangerous. Room was small but nicely decorated and adequate. Older property but fairly well maintained. The staff could not be nicer - it is obvious this is a huge focus - the general manager came up and refilled my coffee one AM while I was sitting by the pool drinking coffee. Good value - good place to set up camp to see Key West on a budget w/kids - if you have to be in the middle of everything and step out your door to all the main attractions, however, plan to pay much more and stay closer to Mallory Square. Note - our room was clean - shower had a little mildew in the grout - but I felt the overall property could have been cleaner - like the common areas - perhaps more pressure washing - you had to walk through covered parking to get to the elevator and it just seemed it could be cleaner - same w/hallways - room seemed recently painted - common areas could use more attention.

Reviews.Title: “Going back in the fall.”
Reviews.Author: deedeebruce
Reviews.Content: with our 2 kids the room was a bit small, but the staff was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service by friendly staff, nice room and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FrequentlyOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. We enjoyed our stay and will stay there again. There is ample parking and also a scooter rental onsite. The staff was very friendly and outgoing. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: tor_torden
Reviews.Content: first of all. hotel prices are high in Key West in general. You can compare it to New York. The location of this hotel is next to the main road and that causes a considerable amount of noise. Staff was generally friendly despite the fact that the manager started an argument with us in the lobby. for our part the whole thing with giving out discount coupons for places to drink (buy one drink, get one for free) reminded us of party-charter-tourism to Ibiza, and takes away the exotic experinence of going to Key West. It underlined that if you want to see something enjoyable in Key West you better be drunk, which is not the fact at all. Key West is a place to visit no doubt. Lots of stuff to do, and plenty of amazing restaurants offering high class seafood. The restaurant neither had a lactose nor a gluten free selection of food, and the breakfast reminded me of prior experiences at Holiday Express or Days Inn. There are plenty of hotels in Key West. This one would definitely not be my 1st choice for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend with the family”
Reviews.Author: goingplacestc
Reviews.Content: Very nice property however the pictures on the website was a bit misleading as it gave the impression that the King Suite was much larger than the actual size. We got an end unit which the view from the suite was the concrete wall of the walk way.even when you open the shutters the lighting was poor. The manager Chris, should take a refresher course in guest relations as he was not very tactful in advising me at check that there was no AARP /AAA or Travel Agents rate available. He chose to yell this out very loudly in his response and within ear shot of the other guest who were waiting to check in. He also barked at me that the hotel was FULL. As a Marriott member and a Guest I was really appalled by his demeanor and tone. I will continue to book other hotels in the Marriott chain however not this location.

Reviews.Title: “I only stay at Marriots This property topped the charts”
Reviews.Author: Stepohen
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful The Gm was what other types of hospitality facilities should use as an example Stephen Kaufman Lake Worth Florida

Reviews.Title: “Excellent people at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: nncbubblegum
Reviews.Content: A bed was not comfortable to us, but the folks at this hotel (at check-in, at pool, at breakfast area, at laundry) made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ivory70
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff was nice and helpful and the rooms were nice and clean. The only suggestion I would have for the hotel is to operate a shuttle to downtown. We had to pay $20 a day for a cab. No shuttle is the only negative about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheRafattis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June 2011 on a vacation trip to Key West- and found we made an excellent choice from among the many options available! The entire hotel is very clean and neat and our room (a King studio) was lovely, nicely decorated, and bright. The bed was comfortable and the private balcony overlooking the pool a nice plus. Bathroom was more spacious than most hotels of this type, and tile floors throughout the room were a welcome change from difficult to keep clean carpeting we've encountered at other places. Service from the staff was truly outstanding and always friendly! Everyone we encountered went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and to offer suggestions on how to best enjoy Key West! The pool is lovely (actually as nice as pictured on the hotel website!) with lots of seating available and features a poolside tiki hut that serves a daily reasonably priced drink special along with its regular full bar menu. A poolside limited buffet breakfast was included each morning; food was fresh and menu included a couple of non-standard items along with the typical cereal, fruit, and make-it-yourself waffles. The hotel is located about 2 miles from the "downtown action"- but the ease of free parking onsite and sight-seeing trolley that stops there frequently make up for that small inconvenience. This is an entirely nonsmoking hotel- something my husband and I especially appreciated! One drawback for some might be the lack of elevator to the second floor rooms in some areas of the hotel. Although there is no restaurant onsite there are numerous restaurants in the area from which to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the location.”
Reviews.Author: Mochadog8
Reviews.Content: This hotel served a wonderful free hot and cold breakfast. Plenty of free parking, some covered. The pool is HUGE! The regular room was so small that our family of 4 could barely walk around. The regular room did NOT have micro or fridge. The beds were FULL, not queen, and there was barely room for the 2 beds. We are platinum elite with Marriott so we asked to be upgraded to a suite as soon as possible and 2 days later we got a suite for no charge. The suites were 2 room; large and spacious. A spacious living with a sleeper couch, fridge, microwave, table, 2 chairs, business desk, and desk chair. In addition there was a lounge chair and a coffee table. The TV was flat panel. There could have been more channels. In the bedroom, the beds were clean and comfortable but a little soft for my back. The bath was very small with a modern tiled shower- no tub. The bedroom is separated from the living by a glass, curtained, locking door. The windows did not open and did not have curtains. They did have nice shutters.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: LJA247
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very friendly and accommodating but the rooms and bathroom were very small. The room doors were very heavy for some reason too! The beds were reasonably comfortable and we didn't have any other problems. The room was clean also. The continental breakfast was very good. They served the usual fare with cereal, bagels, toast and sandwiches you could heat up in the microwave, as well as make-your-own waffles. They also offered some fruit options. We didn't use the pool but it was nice and big with fountains.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JPMC_03
Reviews.Content: We drove down from Miami to Key West for a few days and stayed at the Fairfield Inn... I must say, we loved it. The service was WONDERFUL! Everyone at the front desk was lovely. The room was a bit small for 4 adults, but all we really used it for was to shower and sleep. Everything was very clean and well maintained. There is plenty of parking available. One thing we liked most was the breakfast. Most hotels that offer complimentary breakfast will only have muffins, bagels, juice and coffee. But Fairfield had sandwiches, fresh fruit, a waffle-making station, oatmeal, and more... We also loved the fact that there was a scooter rental desk right on the property.... I will DEFINITELY be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the southernmost point in USA!”
Reviews.Author: StrongGOd
Reviews.Content: From the first minute to the last minute in this Hotel we always felt like in home. We arrive at the hotel with some requirements for our stay and the staff was always open to ear us and make what they could for us. I was amazed with the stay here. Really! Every single minute people are worried with you and ensuring that you are experience the best holidays ever. If you need help in any activities outside the hotel, there is the best place to ask for that help. They are always grateful in help you. And the good thing is that you notice that. We get an amazing room in the hotel. 10 steps away from the pool. View to the pool. And like a home. With living room and bed room. Fantastic, Amazing, â€¦ Anything negative to point in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elsimone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel may 31-June 3rd. We found the hotel rooms to be clean and cozy. Our room had tile floor which was nice since we have a young child learning to walk -- I didn't worry about him crawling on the floor. The pool was fun, pool towels were provided with plenty of lounge chairs and a pool bar. There was a great breakfast served poolside each morning for free which included cereal, waffles, yogurt and pastries. Free parking was ample and it was just a short drive to many of the activities on key west. Overall a great bargain and I should highly reccommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and breakfast but that was about it.”
Reviews.Author: sebeals
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Key West we decided to stay at the Fairfield Inn and Suites - I was extremely disappointed in the rooms. I thought that they were exceptionally small. Our room was located near the elevator and we were kept awake most of the first night of our stay by everyone returning from the bar in the middle of the night. The next day we did relocate to a room along the back of the hotel - so our view was only of the parking lot but at least it was quiet. Pool area was great as was the breakfast but by Marriott standards - this was certaintly not a category 5 hotel. My next trip back to Key West in April was definitely not spent at the Fairfield.

Reviews.Title: “They room was clean and beds were comfortable. The location of our room was on the noisy, next to highway.h”
Reviews.Author: Lacrosse4
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and beds were comfortable. The AC was noisy went it came on. We experienced some noise issues since our room was next to highway. The pool and the breakfast were great. My main issue was that I requested a room refrigerator to store medicines and was was not in the room when we arrived on May 27th at 10pm and no one tried to accommodate this request during our stay. This was a major inconvenience since we had to continue to use the ice machine to keep our medicines cool. I was hoping that the fridge would arrive at least on Saturday but that didn't happen on Saturday or Sunday. Being a Marriott rewards customer this was disappointing. When I made this request in the past it was never an issue. I thought about checking out but it was a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The people make the difference”
Reviews.Author: svk_belgium
Reviews.Content: I was not too keen on the rooms, clean and spacious but a bit dark. Location is too far to walk to the center but you can rent bikes onsite so that should do . Price value is ok for Key West. Parking is free, internet is free, breakfast is free. Lovely pool, great bar tenter. Breakfast was good and complete, staff at the breakfast bar was just lovely welcoming. So if I would go to a B&B or inn it would not be for the extra personal touch, because this hotel has this already. But it's not central when you want to go out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, charming pool area and environment, friendly staff, but separated from the ocean by a road”
Reviews.Author: FrenchDetroiter
Reviews.Content: Overall really good hotel, good location, nice rooms even though they were missing some amenities in the rooms (no fridge for example). Even though I rarely use the pool when on vacation because I prefer touring the touristic locations, I have to say the pool area was very charming. You can take your breakfast by the pool which is surrounded by a lush tropical garden, making your experience very enjoyable. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean. The only negative might be the location. While it is nicely located in Key West (easy access - plus the island is small of course :), it is not by the beach if this is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: DustyS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my trip to Key West. When we arrived, we were greeted with a very tasty orange/mango slushy and some beads to wear. Checking in was not very pleasant. All the other reviews said how nice management was. Maybe they had a bad day when I checked in but I found the manager had an "attitude" and not very pleasant at all. When we arrived to our rooms (I was there with a group of 7 friends and four rooms) manager's attitude left a "bad taste" in my mouth. Good points: Nice attractive lobby with a comfortable seating area, exceptionally nice swimming pool, comfy beds and pillows. Did my usual check for beg bugs nowadays, everything was fine. Room minimally decorated shades of blues and whites, windows did not have curtains, but shutters, giving it a nice tropical feel. The bathroom was on the small side but adequate. There was a long narrow shower with a glass door and the toilet was right next to the shower. The sink was located outside the bathroom in a vanity area and had plenty of room for two people to spread their stuff out. The floors were not carpeted but tiled, which I found unusual for a hotel, but I'm sure it was easy to keep clean. Fairly nice free breakfast, although I am not much of a breakfast eater. On the other hand, I did find a black hair on the sheets which concerned me a bit. My friend suggested it probably was from the maid that made the bed up, so I just let it slide. I am very fair and blonde, so it could not have been my hair! The TV needed to be updated to a flat screen. The rest room needed a cleaning in the lobby when I first checked in. I felt that it should have been checked regularly. Although I made two negative comments about the cleanliness of the hotel, I do not want to give a false impression that it was dirty, basically I found it to be very clean with these two exceptions. The hotel is located on the land side and it is about a $15 taxi ride to get to Duval Street. Would I stay there again? Probably not, the only thing that would bring me back is the pool. Would I recommend it it to a friend, maybe, as I already said good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE with a SMILE in a pretty looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: EraCardoso
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel and we stayed in the parking lot waiting for my husband and father in law to go to the lobby to checked in. I was thinking we screwed up on the pick of the hotel, since all we could see was the parking lot and some construction things....It looked like an old hotel but with fresch colors on the outside. We got the keys and went to our room, for a nice surprise the bright colors extended to the inside of the room, putting a smile on my face, it did look small but with the new decoration was a pleasent surprise, all the little details, like a nice lamp, the nice bright white courtains made it a very NICE room!!! I also noticed that the keys matched the colors fresh blue of the room and some parts of the hotel......... good!!! The next morning we went for breakfast and found Joe, a young man taking care of breakfast with a bright big smile on his face, he greated us and made us feel at home. I never got this kind of service in America, and I been in many places before............ Breakfast was very good, and while I had it, I watched Joe give the same smile to everysingle guest, it was amazing......... later he changed places with Mirella, not before she went around and say hello to all of us having breakfast with another big smile, where did you get this people??? The person in charge for teaching them to smile did a good job!!! Sadly we had to go that same day, staying there only one night...... before we left I passed by the reception to use the computer room, as soon as I walked in the lonely reception the 3 persons there gave me a big smile!!! That made my journey to Key west different, thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super helpful and friendly Staff and great outside pool and bar.”
Reviews.Author: TJMRUGMAN
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful in guiding my son and I in finding an offshore charter boat. They made it a point to make sure that our stay was fantastic. The breakfast crew made sure that every guest had a great start to their day. The assortment of breakfast options was better then I have ever experienced at a Fairfield property. The outdoor pool and Bar was nicer then most hotels that cost much more.

Reviews.Title: “Old and poor value: definitely not a Marriott Category 5 standard”
Reviews.Author: CliveHarryW
Reviews.Content: Management and staff were very pleasant and helpful. However, the building is old, rooms are small and dark, A/C is too loud to keep on at night, walls are thin, walkways run along outside all the rooms hence much pedestrian noise, hotel is situated very close to highway US1 and thus noisy, room towels should have been replaced many years ago!!!! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ragarciajr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their suites and while the master bedroom was large, the second room with the pullout couch was not. Service was courteous and "happy". However, we had to call three times and deal with multiple visits from the staff before we received sheets and a bed cover for the pullout bed. The room windows are not darkened in any way. Lots of sunlight comes into it. Not good. Finally, the walls are paper thin, we could hear our next door neighbors and because all rooms face an outdoor walkway we would hear everyone that walked by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Friendly staff, Courteous, Aim to Please, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: sheba09
Reviews.Content: Will definitley return on our next trip to Key West - Morning Breakfast - a big 10!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for simple accomodations”
Reviews.Author: riderhogmama
Reviews.Content: Service was good. Room was older and basic but clean. Pool and tiki bar were nice. Location was good. A/c unit in room worked very well but was noisy, utilized earplugs at night and slept well. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 5milkman5
Reviews.Content: The double occupancy was a little smaller than we expected but very comfortable and all of the ammenities were great. Next time we stay will be in a studio suite for the few extra dollars I'm sure it will be well worth it. To the manager Chris and his crew---my hats off to you. Thank you for making our second vacation to Key West a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dodge029
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay while at Key West. Staff was wonderful , pool was a great place to sit in the sun. They have bike and Scooter rentals right there. Rooms were clean with more towels than we could use.. Bar at the pool was friendly and not over priced.. Would stay here again next time we go there.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!! Iccck!”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner1021
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Key West with our two small children (both under 4) and a few friends for the Keys100 run and decided to make a long weekend out of it. We had 3 rooms in the group all with the same rate. For some reason we had the smallest room out of the group with the most people (2 adults, 2 kids). The room was really really small, no room for a family and all of their luggage. Floor was so dirty our feet and were dirty afer minutes. Walls were painted cinderblock. We had had enough after the first night and asked to be upgraded to alarger room. We had booked for 2 nights. They said they could do it for $20 more so we agreed. Moved over to our room (same building as lobby) and now were on the second floor with two small children and a bunch of luggage that all needed to be carried up the stairs (no elevator, or bell services). So we lugged our stuff up and headed out to Duvall street. Came back a few hours later. Sat down on the pull out couch and saw a bug on the couch...killed it and immediately google bed bugs on our iPad...exact match...then saw another on the floor by the bed...we were outta there. Brought the bug and the iPad to the front desk and showed them...they said nothing but offered a refund and checkout...we gladly accepted. We changed to the Double Tree Resort a few miles away...felt like we moved to a luxury resort. The staff at Fairfield were always friendly..the pool was nice and the breakfast was great...but that should be the standard...and so should cleanliness...and it wasn't. It really did feel like a cheap motel and not a Marriott. That being said, the other two rooms in our party didn't find any bugs. Also, heads up..we called the Sheraton and asked a few questions..the girl at the front desk said they hadn't had reports of bed bugs since December..um, goodbye! The location is far from Duvall and Mallory square 10-15 mins...but that wasn't a big deal to us since we had our cars with us. Overall would never recommend this place...head to the doubletree you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like being at home”
Reviews.Author: pkflamngo
Reviews.Content: What an adorable room! Painted in a beautiful blue with textured white sponging, it felt like being in my own bedroom. Furniture was beautiful, bathroom modern and very clean. We had a junior suite and it was very roomy! Our welcome by the front desk clerks was very pleasurable, especially after a long drive. It's a bit far from Duval Street, but our event was closer to the entrance to Key West anyway so it was perfect. The only real (sort of) negative, was the noise from the traffic on the main road. We were in the front of the hotel so it was somewhat noticeable. But we managed to sleep quite well. Price was right, hotel was beautiful. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, AMAZING Staff!”
Reviews.Author: crazyzeus1
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel after checking OUT of Beachside Marriott because it was so distasteful! The front desk at the Fairfield went above & beyond to help us get a room, make sure my son had some fun treats, & square away our problems using points with the Marriott Customer Service on the phone. The front desk staff must have spent over an hour helping us get everything squared away. Customer service is HUGE in my book. The hotel itself is a very pretty property. Nice, large pool with little spray fountains all around. Comfy lounge chairs, yummy drinks at the bar near the pool, & a very nice, standard breakfast area in the covered, open air dining area. Breakfasts included cereals, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal fixings, muffins, bagels, english muffins, a waffle machine, & microwaveable options such as Egg/Bacon/Cheese biscuits & pancake/sausage "corn" dogs. The breafkast staff was super friendly, ready to grab anything you needed or clean your table. My husband was able to access the free WiFi at the pool & breakfast area. The rooms were comfortable, & the front desk staff was able to bring a mini-fridge & microwave to our room for us. The AC was strong. The TV was a little dated, not a flat screen like most hotels now. The shower was large. No tub. Room had all tile floors. Our room was next to the pool, but we never heard any noise. Most nights, my son & I were the only ones swimming during the dark. I think most people went out to Mallory Square at night. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. Fair price, good location, comfortable rooms. And the BEST customer service we have received in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, pretty pool area and great morning coffee.”
Reviews.Author: Fromoff
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Fairfield inn in Key West. The staff was so friendly and seemed to sincerely enjoy their jobs. The room and bathroom were clean and the bed and pillows were very comfy. The only complaint I have is that when the AC kicks on, it is very loud and you can't hear the tv over the noisy system. That's ok though since we didn't hang out in the room that much. We had a blast and the Fairfield inn was a comfy place to return to each day after a packed day of all the good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gussybear53
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel 3x,great value,convenient to Duval st but away from the noise to get a good nights sleep.Cute key west style hotel,pretty pool area which you can have all to yourself.Very relaxing for a swim at dusk when pool area is all lit up.The a/c works very well and is not noisy and rooms stay a constant cool temp which is very important after a 96 degree day in the Keys.Showers have good water pressure and are updated which is sometimes hard to get in the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: jeanqueen20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose to stay here for his brothers wedding this past weekend. The main reason is because we got a free night with points. We stayed four nights in a king room. It was nice but we were a little disappointed because the room was a lot smaller than we thought it was going to be. I recommend upgrading to the king suite to give yourself more room. The shower was really nice and the room was clean. The bed was comfortable also. We also very much enjoyed the pool. Big, clean, and cheap drinks from the tiki bar. The major downside was that it was so loud every morning and hard to sleep in. We heard the same noises every morning. Housekeeping going up and down the hallway and banging around and the roosters around constantly crowing. The AC in our room was very loud as well. I'm not sure if I would stay here again but would recommend it if noises don't bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: bsherman1986
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very relaxing and in a calming location. The continental breakfast was very good and there were plenty of activities to do while there. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Very cozy and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyslipperMN
Reviews.Content: Great service, very nice rooms, (outdoor entrance to rooms) beautiful & very large pool surrounded by palm trees & shrubs so it's somewhat secluded from view. Very nice breakfast next to the pool. Only down side is it's located on a very busy/noisy highway ( the main highway in & out of Key West) & is about 2 miles from downtown Key West. I think almost all of the rooms are set back off the highway far enough to keep the noise to a minimum & also the rooms have a continuos fan option on the air conditoning system to muffle any highway noise. A good choice would be a room set back as far as possible from the highway but still overlooking the pool. The Old Town Trolley is the way to go to get downtown. They stop every half-hour at The Fairfield & 11 other stops on the island between 9am & 4:30 pm. It costs about $29.00.(It was good for 2 days which may have been a special being offered while I was there.) You'll need to take a cab back to the hotel after trolley is done for the day (about $11.00) There is a grocery store & shopping center within walking distance. Overall a great hotel to stay at if you don't mind being 2 miles from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Staff does an excellent job - so very very friendly and helpful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Funinthesun823
Reviews.Content: We had a great time there - beautiful pool, clean room - loved it!! But the best was the wonderful service from ALL of the staff!!! Front desk staff friendly and wanting to help you in any way they can!! Fella that brought us a fridge for our room was great - smile on his face! One of Housekeeping staff told me she'd take care of me when I said I didn't want to go home!!! Just nice, happy, friendly people. Made our stay very enjoyable! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!! You really can get away without a car - the cab fares are cheap since the island is so small! Great place to vacation - I WILL be back! Thanks everyone at Fairfield!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSteppinOut
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more pleased with the service. Upon entering the main lobby, you are welcomed with big smiles and a professional staff. Although all were good, one employee stood out. Her name is NORA. She is absolutely wonderful. She took the time to explain the differences in the various attractions and made the reservations for us. She was a joy!!!! Also, the "continental breakfast" is one that I have never seen before. I was expecting cereal and fruit. On the contrary, they had eggs, breakfast sandwiches, muffings, rolls, bagels, oatmeal, waffles, fruit, yogurt, and the list goes on. BARBARA, one of the ladies who appeared to supervise the breasfast, is wonderful as well. Each morning, you were greeted with a smile and a kind word. We felt as if we had known her for years. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the pool is spectacular. I would saty here again and would recommend this place without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Diana050_11
Reviews.Content: This property offered free parking and the breakfast was pretty good. The location was out of the way from the main attractions (beach and Duvall Street) but was a stop on the trolley tour so you could get to the attractions. The staff was friendly and the property was clean and well-maintained. The AC unit in our room was pretty loud - cutting on and off all night. Not a bad experience but nothing special made this property stand out.

Reviews.Title: “double queen not comfy for 3 or 4 ppl”
Reviews.Author: Flitzmaus
Reviews.Content: we arrived late in the evening and had problems finding a room... Mariott was fully booked but for one king... and Courtyard had no vacancy... so we checked in into a 2 queen family room. High season and high demand probably and being in Key West justified the 200 USD. Rooms off the mainroad are alright, but the AC noise is unbearable.. Negative: No wardrobe, a couple of hangers in the corner next to the washingbasin Negative: Curtain next to washbasin is merely hiding the pseudowardrobe and cannot be drwan, so no privacy. Negative: Room to small if suitcases have to lay, stand about the room. Difficult: Not well postsigned and difficult to find, evenings or nights Breakfast was included, basic but ok. We did not use pool, so no comment. Positive: Staff very friendly and helpful, no matter what time of day or night Positive: Free use of Computers in Lobby Positive: Nice Lobby Positive: Plenty of breakfast tables in the shade or in the open sun

Reviews.Title: “Platium Member comments”
Reviews.Author: jblatz
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Hotel I've ever stayed in, Key West Fairfield Inn and Suites. The AC is so loud, I couldt sleep. The room is not even close to the quality at previous Marriott facilites I've stayed in. I would be better off staying in a Hotel 8! I asked to change rooms and was told all the AC units are loud in all rooms and it wouldn't do you any good to switch rooms. I tried to booked at another local Marriott, Courtyard had nothing available, The Key West Beachside had rooms available but could not agree on a price. Online the price was $215, they wanted to charge me $239. I'm doing business at the Local Medical center, Lower Keys Medical Center, so theycould discount it down to $209 for the first night only. I am a Platium member and I am very disappointed with the lack of ability to accomendate me for the $179 rate.If I'm not compensated our rewarded with my lack to sleep for four nites, I will never stay at a Marriott Facility again! I spoke with Mario on the phone and he was less than accomendating, couldn't get the story straight and was less than helpful! I am a business Medical Professional International Traverer and travel about 42 weeks out of the year and stay in a Marriott if one is within 15 - 20 miles of the site I'm working at. Marriotts are not always an option, but, are my first choice. >Respectively Submitted,

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: irishfaith
Reviews.Content: Very affordable comfortable rooms. The pool is very nice and relaxing. Everything was very clean and cozy. The staff was amazing. I messed up my reservation and they fixed it without a problem. Lindsey was GREAT!!! The hotel is a little far from Duval St. and all the other sites, but we would drive in and park in a garage near Mallory Square and walk around. I would stay at the Fairfield Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt find a better place close to airport”
Reviews.Author: JulieD9876
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but the front desk were very helpful and friendly. Helped us in getting our car to rental agency and back to hotel prior to leaving the next day. That ended up probably saving us 1 hour in time early in the mornining + the cost of having car overnight @ Marriott. 2 for 1 happy hour, good breakfast in the morning also. Definitely would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “You cannot go wrong with Marriott, the name stands for quality.”
Reviews.Author: drwren
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff at the Fairfield. The best customer service I've had in a long time! They were very helpful recommending restaurants and activities. They also have THE BEST POOL AND BAR, which is top priority for me, considering the poor beaches @KW. We rented a scooter right on the property, which is KEY! ONLY complaint...rooms could use a little update;)

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied - would recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: annie032156
Reviews.Content: -Visibility/Recognition from road needs to be better. Fairfiled sign in between 2 palm trees - I saw it the day I left. Another sign was obstructed by current construction items. I drove by twice looking for the motel. -Pool Area is beautiful. -Tables for breakfast needed to be wiped off initially and between uses - black film on the table i sat at -My room floor had a black film on surface. When I got in bed my feet bottoms were black. I took a tissue and wiped the floor - black. I asked the desk clerk the next morjning to be sure my room floor was mopped. It was. -Other than the floor, my room was fine. -Staff was helpful. accomodating and delightful. -Good location-, good access.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice when visiting Key West.”
Reviews.Author: CA_KDM
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff and nice clean rooms that include amenities like walk-in showers & mini-fridges plus the bed was extra comfy. Had a room that faced US 1 and it was a bit noisy, but not to the point of annoyance and it did not disturb our sleep. Lack of elevator in our wing made lugging the suitcases up and down the stairs a chore. This was only an inconvenience not worth getting upset over as the staff was more than willing to help. Breakfast included in the room and it was the typical "Continental" fare served in most hotels in the Fairfield class. The hotel's General Manager was on hand to greet guests and make sure they were taken well care of which was a nice touch. All-in-all, a very good value compared to the closer-in but much pricier alternatives. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not great location”
Reviews.Author: cbober711
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield was overall a great hotel. I wish it was closer to all of the main attractions like Duval Street or the beaches. It got pricy to take cabs everywhere. The rooms are a bit small so definitely get a suite if you have more than 2 people. The pool area and tiki bar are fabulous with drink specials everyday. They have a nice business center in the lobby. The hallways are all outside and the rooms are detached from the lobby so the elevator was kind of far to drag the luggage to. I would stay here again only if I was looking to only relax by a pool. If you want to go to a beach or enjoy the nightlife, definitely stay somewhere closer to those areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Love the pool!”
Reviews.Author: mngirl1234
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here March 12-19 during our first trip to Key West. I had checked the reviews constantly up until we left on 3/12 and everything is pretty accurate. Check-in went smoothly and we were greeted with drinks and necklaces. We had booked a room with two queen beds and I was concerned since I knew it wouldn't have a fridge. But all we did was ask for a fridge to be brought in and it was, free of charge!! We were in room 136 and it's a good room, good location right outside of the pool. I was also concerned that we would hear the people above, but I didn't hear anything the entire week, on any side for that matter. I loved the shower, but I wish it would have had a seat or something, it's certainly big enough for it. But other than that - typical hotel, I didn't think the room was that small from the other posts, even with two of my family members there. Clean linens, but fyi - there is no closet, just a small shelf thing with some hangers. And good/standard continental breakfast each morning. And one more thing, there are posts regarding the air conditioner - it is loud, but not loud enough to wake me up (I'm a light sleeper) and we didn't hear any roosters at dawn. I LOVE the pool there and you can always find chairs.. easy. This was a big deal for my family and I so I paid attention to the chairs and was happy they were always available. The only thing was that they do have construction going on so it's noisy in the afternoon, but it wasn't bad. Plus they have several fountains which are on. I would much rather stay at the pool than go to the beach. We went to Fort Zachary Taylor - pretty expensive from taking a taxi, to the entrance fee to renting an umbrella/chairs.. should have stayed at the pool!!! In terms of location - it's pretty far from Duval and all of those activities. We ended up taking a lot of taxis, which aren't cheap. I suggest the pink taxis. There is a CVS/Walgreens/ TGI Fridays/ Dominos within walking distance - maybe 5-10min walk. We also got delivery from a place on Duval street (Amigos?) one night - delivery for this hotel is a good option. The last thing was when we checked out, we noticed that there were two Trolley tickets charged to our room. They were not ours so someone had used our room number and ended up getting the tickets for free since according to the front desk staff. They were good about removing the tickets from our bill and making sure my credit card wasn't charged (at least they said it wouldn't be). I just can't believe people these days - using someone else's room and forging a signature. Make sure you go over your bill!! But all in all, I liked this hotel a lot and would stay here again as well as recommend it. I hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay In Key West”
Reviews.Author: yurgis
Reviews.Content: We did a spur of the monment trip to Key West and the Fairfield Inn was great. It would have been nice to be on the beach but they have a very nice pool and a great tiki bar right on the deck. The staff at this facility were extremely knowledgeable and very accommodating. The one staff member that went out of her way to help was Lindsley. Our only complaint was the size of our room, very small, but again this was take what was available because of our timing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations every day!”
Reviews.Author: 1funtraveler1
Reviews.Content: Great staff!, Clean rooms & Grounds The staff Exceeds out expectations every time! We stay here every trip to key west! Not in old town so you do need a car or a cab to go most places but it"s worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Lori1961er
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful experience. We were welcomed heartily with fruit punch and Mardi Gras beads. I didn't have to search for my reservation info, and just gave the attendant my name and it was readily found. The suite we stayed in was very comfortable. Nicely attended to. The only thing that was weird was the position of the toilet paper roll in the restroom. Upon sitting on the toilet you would also be sitting on the roll of paper. Even though it was small, you would think that if they had only raised it up 6 inches it would not have been in the way. The continental breakfast was well tended, but got really busy as the 10 a.m. cutoff neared. The pool is really fun with it's fish fountains totally surrounding the pool. The sightseeing Trolley comes directly to this location. We were pleasantly surprised when a hotel worker came and helped us check out and get tickets for attractions. Overall, it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: BrightonGreg
Reviews.Content: You might drive right by this one, but it is not a normal Fairfield. It has a 'Keys' ambience, for example all rooms look on to the large pool, open bar, and breakfast area, and the rooms themselves are very colorful. Staff are extremely helpful and courteous. Great value compared to some of the very pricey hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Nice and Clean.”
Reviews.Author: Blazin65
Reviews.Content: Like others have said, the room is small, but for two normal size people, it's fine. Not recommended if you are 250 pounds + and require major room just to move around. My guess is that the people who make comments about the size of the hotel rooms are carrying a few extra pounds. The bathroom was very nice, very updated. In fact, the bathroom and shower are the nicest part of the room. If you are wondering about the walk to Duval Street, it does take some time. My friend and I are pretty fast walkers and in shape, but it probably took us @ 40 minutes to get down there. Don't walk all the way down Hwy 1 to Duval. Start on Hwy 1 then take a right on Palm Avenue then follow Eaton Street. It ends on Duval where all the action is. It's a big difference in time. But even this "angle" was still 40 minutes. Ask the hotel staff if unclear.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend a couple days”
Reviews.Author: ChuckN101
Reviews.Content: We had and outstanding stay at your hotel. The staff bends backwards to try to meet your every need.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this hotel solidified my commitment to Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: ukfannga
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic staff. Don & Lindsey were life savers along with Jeff Emmett. My daughters trip would have been ruined not to mention in an unsafe situation if these folks had not gone out of their way to help me. I will always be grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Want to go where everyone treats you like family?”
Reviews.Author: maddie1023
Reviews.Content: We stayed in key west fairfield inn for a week & enjoyed every minute our check in withJeff was so friendly & professional & set the tone for our stay . We especially enjoyed our breakfast staff from Barbara who we remember from the year before to Mirella from Peru who was sooo energetic to Jeff from South Africa with the great smile . thanks to everyone . steve & Mary anne

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to access all parts of the island!”
Reviews.Author: EricCoon
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was a little difficult since the sign is hidden by palm trees and parking got a little tight but overall this was a very comfortable, quiet place to relax after a day in the sun and walking down Duval Street. Breakfasts were always fresh and the staff were always smiling (even first thing in the morning). We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy airconditioner ....3am rooster call every day!”
Reviews.Author: JohnBourgon
Reviews.Content: The airconditioner was so loud sleep was difficult. With the airconditioner off the local roosters would wake you around 3am each morning and the road noises (emergency vechicles) would wake you at all hours. The pool was excellant and free breakfast was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Style”
Reviews.Author: havelock78
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in mid-April. The hotel is approximately 1.5-2 miles from old Key West and Duval Street. We were afraid that the location near the main road make that the room will be rambunctious - nothing has happened. Appearance of the hotel is like the whole architecture of Key West. We had a double room - average size but clean and well maintained. Comfortable beds, nice bathroom (tiles floor, lots of towels). Continental breakfast is eaten outdoors, nice variety of products. Swimming pool clean and not crowded. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seakat1043
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Feb.9th for what was supposed to be for "just a few days".......BUT we ended up being so comfortable at this hotel that we ended up staying until March 3rd! We are a traveling family with a 5 year old son. Stayed in many hotels across the U.S., And we can honestly say that this has been the BEST stay ever!!! NOT a single complaint. Room was cleaned daily and thoroughly,,Pool was amazingly clean. I stongly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to key west. I know that we are coming back soon and will be back to our little home away from home!!! Hats off to this hotel and to Jeff, Nora, Lindsey, etc...,, THANK YOU!!!! YOU guys are THE BEST!!!!!!!!! Kathy, Bobby, And Gage!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: carolerae78
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were perfect for our weekend getaway. It was quiet, charming. We were celebrating my 50th birthday. We loved Key West. Great place to get away and have fun! The staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room was perfect and clean. Nice comfortable bed and amenities! We will definetely stay at the Fairfield Inn when we return to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “This place was paradise!”
Reviews.Author: MrsV3
Reviews.Content: The pool was great. The staff was the friendliest I have ever experienced. Always there with a smile. The continental breakfast was outstanding. We really enjoyed our stay it was like another honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hospitality...”
Reviews.Author: abacojustin
Reviews.Content: Please allow me to start by saying that your entire team is phenomenal and commend you on your job of assembling such a strong group of hospitality professionals. My fiancÃ© and I were in Key West for the wedding of my best friend and it was our first visit to your little piece of paradise. We shipped several packages to the hotel in advance of our arrival (I imagine it was the talk of the break room as it got a bit ridiculous with more than 15 packages being shipped overall â€“ sorry about this!). Your team was great about it and had them waiting for us when we got there late Wednesday evening. I wish I could remember all of the names of the employees that went out of their way to help us during our stay and I apologize as Iâ€™m sure that Iâ€™m leaving some of them out, but here it goes: - Nora â€“ She went above and beyond repeatedly for us during our stay - Ed? (Front Desk Agent from Baltimore or DC â€“ canâ€™t remember which) â€“ He was very helpful and also went out of his way to assist us - The entire Peruvian team â€“ they are all awesome and so friendly!! - The gentleman from South Africa that works at breakfast has hospitality in his blood!! Incredibly friendly and willing to assist at all times. Thanks for creating such fond memories of your hotel and your city. We hope to come back and visit soon!

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ckelle2
Reviews.Content: The room was fairly small, not a suite room. The bathroom had an interesting smell. The rooms are loud. You can hear the people in the adjacent room and if anyone is rolling a suit case down the walk, you will hear it. The staff were extremely friendly which is why I would recommend staying here. It is not typical to spend the whole amount of time in your room on vacation, so as long as it is a place to stay, it is worth it. I was able to book last minute with them and it was worth the trip. It does require a taxi to get downtown, but old charter row is a short walk away. For the fisher, it is a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service, would definitely come back again!”
Reviews.Author: BicFamily
Reviews.Content: ROOMS: Comfortable beds, quiet at night, plenty of hot water. Overall rooms are good, normal hotel rooms. BREAKFAST: Typical complimentary breakfast, cereals, fresh fruit, breakfast sandwiches, bagels, yogurt, oatmeal, waffle makers, juices, coffee, tea. Coffee was very good, kids loved fresh made waffles, oranges were real fresh. Two best parts are having breakfast outside in glorious weather and the incredibly friendly staff. POOL: We're not much of a beach swimming family to begin with and the beaches in Key West aren't as nice as a lot of other places. So the pool was important to us. Swam every day we were there, the pool is warm, clean and spacious. Never a problem getting lounge chairs, having room to feel comfortable...or anything really. Poolside tiki bar is just steps away for whatever kind of drink you need, different frozen specials every day...we went for Pina Coladas that were excellent. LOCATION: I prefer to stay outside of the main drag (no pun intended) to have a little more quiet, be able to go to come and go as we please, and not feel too crowded...so this was perfect for us. Did the Old Town Trolley first day (stops on site) to get some history and feel of the area, gets a little long at times but we all enjoyed it. Drove close to Duval/Mallory Sq just about every day & night..takes about 5-6 minutes. Was concerned about parking but there are a bunch of lots close to the area if you don't mind the $15-20. Grocery, liquor and food all pretty close to hotel. OVERALL: Great all-around place to stay. Never felt crowded even though the place was pretty full. Really impressed with the staff, very friendly, attentive, concerned with the guest's happiness.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cleand”
Reviews.Author: Ingy3105
Reviews.Content: this is my first time for me and my friends to go to Key West . We very enjoy key west and also my friend like this hotel I'm the one who's booked this hotel and the time that we went most of the hotel that close to key west town was fully book. I know that this hotel little bit far from the town but I already compare if we stay close but we have to pay more or we stay a little far but we pay cheper event include for taxi. all staff very nice and room was clean and nice. I like it .

Reviews.Title: “Bad Marriott”
Reviews.Author: hbergHudson_Wi
Reviews.Content: It is easily the worst Marriott property I have ever seen. The rooms were tiny. The air conditioner was loudder than an airport air hand dryer! On the way to the room when we got off the elevator, a sign on the wall pointed the wrong way to the room. When we finally found the room, the doorway tile was broken and the door was in bad condition. Broken tiles, peeling paint, open space under the door all contributed to a bad experience. Here is a link to the photos: http://www.howardbergphoto.com/fairfield/ The inside of the room was not up to the standards we expect from Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with a car.”
Reviews.Author: aryka579
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, nice pool, Trolley stop and bike/scooter rental on-site, parking available. Cons: Small room, limited dining options (within walking distance). The hotel is nice, but I would consider renting a vehicle next time I stayed here. The AC unit eliminates all the outside noises including the rooster that gets up with the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value -Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: daytona13
Reviews.Content: I booked this 4 night February stay on Priceline and was awarded this hotel. I was happy to get it from previous reviews and they didnt disappoint. They are in a decent location with grocery and other stores nearby with a 5min bike ride to Duval street. Our room was a bit small but was spotless. The pool area and tiki bar while not spectacular did the job very well. The free Wifi at the hotel worked flawlessly. A big plus was the free parking and large selection for continental breakfast. The breakfast area had your basic fruits,cereals,Jimmy Dean breakfast items,juices/coffee,yogurts,waffles,USA Today newspaper and other items. There is a moped and bike rental kiosk onsite also. The from desk staff and other staff may have been the best Ive ever encountered. Kudos to Mirella(sp) I was hoping for the Casa Marina,Reach,Hyatt or Westin when I was bidding on Priceline. They didnt work out and I was given this gem. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: slickcat1
Reviews.Content: The General Manager, Chris, and desk clerk Nora were extremely accommodating when working through a difficult transaction adjustment. The rest of the staff was also very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were exceptionally clean and the pool, bar, breakfast were wonderful. We highly recommend this place for your stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: peichs
Reviews.Content: We choose the Fairfield Inn for our stay because it was a lower price than the Duval street hotels. While the hotel is not new - (the room was small)- it has been renovated. Our room was clean, the bathroom was clean. The hotel lobby was nice and bright. The pool was beautiful and heated. Each morning the continental breakfast had cereal, muffins, fruit, breakfast sandwiches you could heat and the make your own waffles. The staff was friendly and accommodating. My only disappointment was that our room did not have a small refrigerator. After eating so many wonderful meals it was sad not to be able to take a go box. Also their bar closed at 7 pm. I was pleasantly surprised that we felt safe walking to Duval street and back later in the evening. Be aware that it is a full two mile walk- 1/2 hour at a good clip. There are scooters and bikes to rent at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Last-minute charming find”
Reviews.Author: netmorby110
Reviews.Content: We had to beat a hasty retreat from our originally-reserved hotel in Key West. Called the Marriott 800# and found out they own Fairfield as well. For about $20 less per night than the M. Courtyard, we got WiFi, continental bkfst, and other amenities. I don't know why they price it cheaper. It's a great deal. Our room was clean and comfy. The hotel overall is styled like a Cape Cod inn, with pastel clapboards, ceiling fans, Adirondack chairs and plantation shutters. The continental bkfst by the pool was just delightful. The pool itself is shallow but sparkling and looks something like a Piazza Navona fountain, but with palm trees. I know this sounds like an architectural mishmash but the overall effect is pleasing. There's an exercise room and a coin-op laundry for guests, besides the laundry/cleaning service. Parking is free and the lots are well-maintained. The hotel seemed either brand new or newly renovated. Staff was mostly young, very friendly and courteous. The location is a couple of miles from the main action in Key West, there's a residential neighborhood behind it and roosters crowing in the morning (fun and not so loud they wake you up) and driving is not recommended. Either rent a bike or moped or take a taxi or shuttle into town, then walk around. We took a taxi (the shuttle, $29, goes in a loop and you won't get into the main part of town for 45") and were glad we didn't take bikes because of the extra time it takes to tie them up, stash your helmet, etc. In one day, we managed to make the Hemingway House and gardens, Key West Lighthouse (with panoramic view) and museum, Duval St. strolling and shopping, Mel Fisher Maritime Museum, sunset and dinner at the little-known but acclaimed Colombian Grace. With another day, we'd hit more restaurants and tour the Truman Summer White House. We did stroll through the grounds and admired the ancient, enormous ficus trees.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: nomiam
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not far from downtown and activities - about two km from Duval Street. Pool and room were beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. Continental breakfast was very good. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was next to US, which made it quite noisy at times. I would definitely stay at the Fairfield again and recommend it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rest and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Lilypoo
Reviews.Content: My stay for 7 days was perfect. I had a lovely suite and well taken care of. The hotel staff is terrific. They are always friendly and upbeat and really make you feel welcomed. I especially enjoyed the wonderful breakfast staff Joe & Barbara. The breakfast had many selections, was well presented and always fresh. I would absolutely recommend this hotel especially if you are not interested in the constant downtown activity. There are taxi's that the hotel will book for you. Although no restaurant on property, there is food convenient to the hotel and the hotel has a large selection of order in menus. Totally a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was A-OK”
Reviews.Author: bluffvilla
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. We had a one bedroom suite which was sufficiently roomy. The bed and the sofa both rated about 5 on a 1 to 10 comfort index. Bathroom was spacious. Internet service was excellent. The room and the property were clean and the pool area is very attractive. Parking is free with some covered parking. The free breakfast is typical Fairfield and is served in an open patio area. This hotel is not within easy walking distance of any restaurants or attractions.

Reviews.Title: “For the Keys area - above average!”
Reviews.Author: NicoArbus
Reviews.Content: I go down to the Keys often for work. That being said things are different in the Keys. There are some real dumps to stay in down there and this place is not a dump and is reasonably priced, clean, staff is friendly. If I was on vacation I'd rather be closer to the area attractions but if you don't want to spend an extra $100 or more this is a great alternative. I stayed Jan 2 and paid $150 (including tax) using Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: bojislayer
Reviews.Content: I really cant say too much about this place other than it is average. I think its easier to do a review in list format: Pro: -Reasonably priced - we paid $159 (without tax) on Jan 2, compared to $3-400 for the rest of Key West -Our check-in staff Andrea was super great and helpful. -Decent location - on the main highway right next to plenty of shopping. 5 minute drive to anywhere in Key West. Is right across from the harbor, so can walk across the highway and have a nice place to sit and watch. -Nice heated pool Neutral: -Breakfast was decent. Typical Fairfield Inn breakfast (however, gotta complain about the plates being so small - can you please supply plates that are at least the size of the waffles?) -Hotel is painted nicely. However, it really shows its age. Con: -Rooms are tiny! We stayed in a King Suite and the bedroom had little room for our luggage. We put the luggage in the living room" to be able to walk around the bedroom. -Mattresses are horrible! They are probably 10 years old? Every time my wife or I would move on the bed, it would squeak loudly. -Staff outside of lobby are not overly friendly. Seem too much in a hurry to even return my hello... -Seriously, can you please provide coffee throughout the day? Your staff is tired of coming up with excuses on why some days you have coffee in the lobby and others you dont. Im sure its a cost cutting measure, and some staff do go out of their way to help more than others, but get rid of the coffee makers in the room if that will bring back 24 hour coffee in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone mainly due to the value. If you have money to burn, stay closer to Duval Street. There are several nice inns down there, but they are pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: BGM10
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was my own fault for going to Key West on Dec. 30, which meant peak rates in a place with warm weather and known for knowing how to throw a good party. But with high prices come an expectation of decent accomodations, amenities and service, and I was very disappointed in all of these departments. The King Suite we had booked would have been nice for two people. The king-sized bed and bedroom were fine. But we had booked room for a family of four, which means someone was going to sleep on the sofabed. The problem is, the sofabed was horrible. It was like sleeping on a toolbox covered by tissue paper. In other words, agonizing. I certainly expected better for almost $350 per night. We're talking New York or Miami luxury suite prices, and this room was like a furnished garage compared with a luxury suite. As if the sofabed weren't bad enough, a delivery truck outside my door woke me up at 6 a.m. and continued to make an incredible amount of noise for 25 minutes. Before I knew it was a delivery truck, I actually called the front desk to report that someone was trying to break into the room next door because it sounded like a hammer against metal. Confronted by all of this, the manager was highly apologetic and said that deliveries were normally made after 9 a.m. in order to allow guests to sleep in. He said he was as surprised as anyone that the truck had arrived so early today and made so much noise. He gave me a discount on the room. But he had no explanation to justify the torture of the sofabed, which he claimed was relatively new. The only bright spot in this stay was the staff, which was friendly and helpful -- especially the guy at the bike rental desk. In short, given that the hotel is far from the historic center of Key West, I consider it vastly overpriced for the level of comfort and service that I received, and would never recommend it for a family of four. At best it only justifies a 3-star price and only for two people who can share the main bed. If I ever come back to Key West I will definitely look for a place in the historic old town with more comfort and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff but not quite what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Southland
Reviews.Content: We almost always stay at Marriott hotels and when we saw the Fairfield Inn and Suites in Key West was a category 5, we made a reservation for two nights. The staff was really great and helpful but the hotel itself was not quite as modern as we expected. One advantage it did have was being a stop on the Old Town Trolley so it was easy to get around but I think next time we would stay closer to downtown. Loved Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! great service.”
Reviews.Author: Dd1871
Reviews.Content: We drove in looking for a room with no reservation on christmas eve.a lil pricier then I wanted but was worth it! Great pool and tiki bar.excellent continental breakfast.staff was accommodating and patient with my kids.doesn't look like anything from the front but a great place to stay.it is away from the square though.but was still worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Doc_Genetics
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews posted by other travelers about this hotel and really arrived with a lower expectation but still held out hope because of the Marriott brand promise. However, after spending only one night, I feel that disappointed even with lower expectation. This place looks like converted from a cheap motel. Rooms are small and bathroom is so tiny that you practically cannot have more than one person inside at once. The room smells as soon as you open the door, mostly humid and old house smell. The beds creak and the A/C unit sounds like an airplane taking off every time it is on. The hotel is located 2.5 miles away from the main city attractions and night life... it is not walkable and takes 15-20 dollars cab fare to get there. The saving grace with this hotel is its great front desk staff who has been friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, beautiful pool!”
Reviews.Author: hmarie2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days while vacationing in Key West. The room was really clean and well stocked. The pool is absolutely amazing, almost like you were staying at a resort. There were only two things I would change. The first thing is I would have loved a hot tub. The second thing, which was not the fault of the hotel, were the random roosters that wandered outside, making all kinds of noises in the early morning hours. However, the beautiful tiling and awesome bathroom made up for those two things! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value!”
Reviews.Author: michel1145
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! The A/C unit in our hotel room was so loud that we did not get one good nights sleep during our 3 night stay. It sounded like a jet plane taking off every time it kicked on. The bed was very squeaky. The pool was nice, but we did not use it. The breakfast was decent, only because it was free. Had standard continental breakfast items. Now, the biggest complaint........we had a problem with our bill and the Operations Manager, Jeff Emmett, was far from helpful and really needs to be trained in customer service. We had inquired about using a rewards certificate prior to our stay and we were told no problem. When it did not show up on our bill we went to the front desk and we were put into contact with Mr. Emmet. He was very short, told us that there was nothing that he could do, and further told us that there was no one in Marriott that we could call. Finally, he gave us a number to call. The Marriott customer service rep. was very nice and helpful. She asked me to put Mr. Emmett on the phone. He proceeded to argue with her telling her that there was nothing that he can do and and ended up hanging up on her (remember this was a fellow Marriott employee). He ended up fixing it for us, even though earlier he told us that there was not anything that he could do. We are very loyal Marriott customers and timeshare owners and this is not the kind of service that we are used to from Marriott. If this is a franchise, it is no way to represent the "Marriott" name.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay again, it just wasn't good enough”
Reviews.Author: Twoplus2kids
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the good points: The staff are good, its free parking, wireless internet, really big nice pool. Not so good: Our suite was best described as "an odd shape". Room was tired and in need of updating. Sofa bed was broken (although the front desk did arrange to have it fixed quickly). There just isn't a compelling reason to go back. Ever! It is average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: doc_dance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites in Key West for two nights during a holiday last year, as part of a group traveling down and up the keys for a wedding. Most of the group stayed close to the beach and the city, but we decided to go budget and stay at the other end of town. Big mistake. The room was tiny, we barely fit in with two + luggage. Breakfast was pure plastic horror, the pile of packaging from just some bites was huge and the barely any service staff to clean up. Maybe this is a typical "Continental Breakfast" in the States, but as a well-traveled German this was the worst breakfast I ever had. The second morning we decided to rather visit our friends in the other hotels, where breakfast was also included in the price but much nicer. The pool area was okay, parking free, not much noise - but far away from everything, so we had to drive everywhere we went. Worst part was that some items I gave for dry cleaning came back without the stains removed, and when complaining the manager made clear that he didn't care and we had to pay anyway. No thanks, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - great for the family”
Reviews.Author: sjhokie
Reviews.Content: We chose this location because we were trying to stay out of the excitement, as we had our kids with us. The hotel is about two miles from Duval Street and the sunset at Mallory Square, which is a very easy ride. The facility was very nice, especially as compared to other Fairfield Inns. The pool was beautiful, with nice fountains and a great outdoor bar, and the bartender Mike was a super guy. The lobby was very classy, and the free breakfast offered more choices than most similar places. The rooms looked fresh and were clean. We actually used Marriott points for this one - so the room was free, and I'm not sure what the price would have been. We did not do it, but I would have felt safe leaving the kids in the room and hitting the town for a few hours at night time.

Reviews.Title: “SAFETY ISSUES”
Reviews.Author: mharder4624
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and our room was illegally entered and our personal items stolen while we were out to dinner. The hotel has no idea how the door was opened and there are no safes in the rooms. Do not stay at this hotel! The staff at night is only one desk clerk, the hotel property is wide open with nothing to keep criminals from walking right to your room, and they have no cameras outside of the lobby to record any illegal acts. This hotel has a lot of security concerns and wouldn't even reimburse us for the stolen items from our room. Beware of these problems before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “clean room, no problems”
Reviews.Author: MQ007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and the hotel was comfortable. The room had free wifi, and a good shower with a place to hold shampoo and conditioner off the floor of the shower area (a rarity in many hotel rooms). The breakfast area was large but if the hotel was full, it could be a challenge to find a table at busy times. The pool was a good size for the number of rooms in the hotel but it was 3' - 4'6" so if parents had little kids, they would need to hold onto them at all times (no paddling area where they could just watch). Parking was free and was either just in the parking lot out the back of the hotel or was under the 1st floor rooms so they were undercover (in a carport sense, not a fully enclosed garage). Still, in the heat of summer, undercover parking is a good thing! Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly at check-in. Air-conditioning was far too loud so it was startling when it cut in at 5:30am and made a heck of a racket. Once we turned it off until a more reasonable hour, there were no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Never met nicer hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: GB_from_ATL
Reviews.Content: This was a great value considering the cost at some of the other places you can stay on the island. You will feel welcome as soon as you walk in. Free lemonade and a sample drink from the pool lounge. Pictures from the website are pretty accurate. The rooms aren't that big or fancy but they are very clean and the air worked great. The workout room is a joke but you're in the Keys; run OUTSIDE!!! Used the pull out couch in the suite with the king bed so my parents could have the bedroom. There is not a mattress at all but once I laid down I was able to sleep soundly with my 5 year old son next to me. If you need a safe, comfortable place to crash after sightseeing and shopping, this place is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “good place with a amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: shasta_narnia
Reviews.Content: We usually do not like to stay any hotel having doors opened to outside. We did not realize it until we got over there. But we decided to give it a try. The staff was very nice, and updated our room to 2-room suite for free. Free Internet and free breakfast were also available. The tour bus stops in front of the hotel, and you may ask the receptionist for more information. She also helped us to book tickets to Dry Tortugas National park. The pool is a very beautiful one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: MagusRU
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor.The room was booked for four nights but we stayed only three. We were travelled by car so the proximity to Duval was not the key factor. Hotel seems to be renovated very recently - everything was looking brand new. As Mariott Reward member we got the room facing the opposite side of the street in the middle of the block. So everything was very quite. Checking in was very smooth and we were explained with "must do" things by the staff on the reception. The breakfast was included but very basic to our means (seems to be standard in all Fairfileds). Free WiFi was available and worked well. No freezer in the the rooms but it can be very helpful. There are soft drinks and ice vending machines on every floor. Great value for money if you have car.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean with a decent pool and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eldeesilver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and was very satisfied with our choice. Got a great AAA rate. The room was small but very clean. Nicely ceramic tiled floors and spotless glass doors on the shower... pretty nice for the money. I believe the motel was renovated a couple of years ago. The breakfast was on a covered terrace next to the pool. They had a good selection of fruit, cereal, oatmeal, Bob Evans microwave egg/bacon/cheese biscuits, great coffee ,bagels, toast, yogurt, and 3 waffle stations. Lots of room to eat and no lines for food. The staff kept everything well stocked at all times. The pool area was better than I expected. Tropical atmosphere with a covered outside bar which has ceiling fans to keep you cool. A great place to hang out. The hotel is not too far from the action on Duval street, since Key West is a small island, but it's too far to walk or bicycle. One can rent mopeds right at the hotel if needed. Otherwise a car is needed. The staff was very helpful and friendly. No slow local attitude at the front desk. A couple of annoyances: The air conditioning (that worked well) was very loud, as if it had a super sized fan blowing in the air. Also, the plantation shutters on the window let hallway light into the room when closed at night. There were no curtains to make the room pitch black. I would stay here again. A clean room with a good pool and breakfast meets all of my requirements for a inexpensive hotel. A good value in the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service, okay location”
Reviews.Author: closetoretirement
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield the first week in May 2010. While we were worried at first (exterior doors), our concerns were quickly put to rest. Rooms were extremely clean, beds very comfortable and hotel staff extremely helpful. Hotel is on a busy main road but for the most part the rooms were very quiet. Air conditioning was a bit noisy, but not enought to keep us from sleeping. Hotel is about 2 miles from the heart of Key West. It can be walked but keep the heat in mind. We had rented a car and found street parking most days. Be careful where you park. Towing is enforced. We had to park several blocks from our destinations, but still less than the two miles from the hotel. Trolley is available but expensive per day. Only two complaints about the hotel. The Tiki Bar bartender made a very weak drink, appeared to be short pours. Second, rooms had environmentally friendly toilets. While they came equiped with a sign warning their dislike of "high contents", they were a problem in the normal course of things. Had to have engineering clear it once. (Though they did respond very quickly.) Not sure how this is environmentally friendly when several flushes were needed with each use. Key West was wonderful. Be prepared for a good deal of walking. Not many beaches but the ones they had were lovely. Restaurants were varied and those we visited offered very good quality food. This hotel provides an excellent buffet breakfast included with your room. Food choices were varied and very good. Definitely take advantage of this feature. There is no other restaurant on site. Only breakfast is served. We had some friends traveling with us and they had a studio suite vs. our king room. The king was a bed, small table with two chairs, a dressing area and bathroom. The suite had the advantage of a small sitting area with a sofa, refrigerator and microwave. There was also a small patio overlooking the pool. The pool was very nice. Overall we had a wonderful visit and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service-A bit far away from town”
Reviews.Author: BostonRich617
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel is a bit far from Old Key West, but we walked and had bikes and it worked for us- Service- very proffesional staff- Front desk, pool bar and breakfast staff were all friendly and had a nice greeting each time we walked by. The pool was clean and never crowded. Another note on service- we had a room without a fridge-we asked for one at check-in and we were told it would be right up( we expected a long wait) we put our luggage on the bed and there was a knock on door and the fridge was delivered! Other nice touches-the internet is free and there are TWO computers with a printer right off lobby.
