There is a bike rental on site and the bike/scooter storage rack is in garage and covered and safe.The breakfast is more than enough to get you started for the day- Taxis were always waiting and there is a Trolley Stop on site ( Trolley is $$$$ -walk, rent a bike or try the public bus) We totally agree on the LOUD air conditioner-we had to shut it off at night- we turned it down as cold as it could before we went to bed and then shut it down-

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way, but a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield is a smart and well run hotel on the outskirts of Key West. It's easy to find on the main ring road into the City, but a little awkward due to there being a limited bus service and around 1.5miles from the main City centre. The Key West trolley tour makes a stop outside every 30min though, which is good if you're not into walking. Staff are very courteous and professional. Checking in and out a breeze. The lobby has free coffee (certain times only) and free internet. Free parking is also available to the rear of the hotel. Rooms are well appointed with large comfortable beds and a 'nautical' themed decor (to match the area you're staying in I guess!!). Air con was somewhat noisy and intrusive in both of our rooms, but worked well. The free breakfasts were ample and in a pleasant outdoor environment, and the pool deserves a mention as it's one of the best. All in all a pleasant hotel, a tad expensive and remote for the City, but fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure - Key West”
Reviews.Author: Wicki
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, had 2 rooms (1 King, 1 2doublebeds); rooms were a little small but ok for 2 people staying in 1 room. Very clean, well kept. Staff and room-service perfect. We liked the breakfast - continental - in the mornings at poolside. The pool - just fantastic. Even the water was quite warm for these early April-days. We used taxi to go into Key West and to get home again. Around 15 USD for 4 people. Try to get rooms away from the mainroad, it can be very loud from the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Charming environment, great price... Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: mandiesh
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced and was walking distance to the marina we were going out of for Kiteboarding lessons every day. It is about a mile north of most of the main attractions and beaches of Key West. Conveniently there are bikes available to rent on site at a good rate. The breakfast in the morning is very nice: Good selection, great environment by the pool, complementary newspaper, and amazingly friendly staff. The pool area is very nice. Free WiFi. Restaurants, drug stores, and grocery stores are within walking distance. If you are looking for the Key West experience and are on a budget this is perfect. Definitely get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice pool, that's it!”
Reviews.Author: RhonnaK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn Key West two nights 3/22-3/24. The pool and surrounding areas were nice and very pleasant, bartender in the 'tiki' bar wasn't too friendly but manageable. The rooms need major renovation, they were pretty gross & very disappointing for a Fairfield Inn. Bugs, bugs, and more bug bites when we left. My travel partner had little bites on her hips & legs. Overall, it was just dirty. I am a Gold Marriott Member, my friend was Platinum, therefore we frequent Marriott brand hotels often. Needless to say, I will not return to the Fairfield Key West and will try the Courtyard or Marriott next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area!”
Reviews.Author: MissMyDog
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here. On the last night our AC went out in the room. Staff took a look at it and couldn't fix it, we were moved to another room. No big deal, they handled the issue well. The rooms are a bit stark because the floors are tile, I prefer a carpeted room. Nice tile in the bathrooms. Good lighting for reading in bed. We LOVED the pool area. It is a huge pool. The free breakfast is poolside at their Tiki Bar. Basic choices but a good start to the day. Their is a shop by the Tiki Bar on the hotel grounds, they rent bicycles and mopeds. Very cool and reasonable rates. The bicycle was $6 for 4 hours or $19 for 24 hours. They give you a lock and a helmet, also the bike has a basket for your belongings. Fun! Oh and go to Daddy Bones BBQ next door. GREAT FOOD! It is a bit noisy at night as you are on a main street and there is an ambulance company a block away. Close location to a liquor store and near grocery stores too. It is about a 2 mile walk to downtown. We loved Lazy Dog Kayak rental as well, $20 for an all day rental, can't beat that. They give you a map to the area so you can know where you are kayaking.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, not a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: WorkmanVa_
Reviews.Content: Outside and check in great. Room small, not comfortable beds, no closet.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: greginmd
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here in Feb 2010. The hotel was what youâ€™d expect to find at other Fairfield Inns. Parking/check in/pool all were fine. Continental breakfast was standard. Suite for 4 people was adequate. We had a king size bed which was nice. The kids used the fold out in a separate room (with TV). Water pressure was good. We couldnâ€™t hear the highway from out location behind the pool. All tourist attractions in Key West are a good 10 min drive from the Fairfield. If youâ€™re ok with that then itâ€™s a fine place to stay. A few days here would be good here but if youâ€™re down for a week, Iâ€™d look for a place with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Above average but not great - ok for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveler2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel about a month ago and had a good time in Key West for three days. The major downside was that the hotel was a bit far from the attractions and Duval street, but since we had a car, it was ok. Amenities were great including the free breakfast by the pool area with both indoor and outdoor seating. It did seem to get a bit crowded between 8 - 9 though. The room was quite small for the price and a little outdated, but the free parking was a plus. Our room was in the back so it was fairly quiet at night; noticed that there were several rooms facing the busy street in the front of the property. There are a few restaurants/shops nearby including a nice Thai place that we dined at one night a short distance away. The hotel staff seemed to be quite friendly and helpful with suggestions regarding things to do and restaurant options as well. They also have scooter and bike rentals on-site which was quite convenient. Overall, the hotel was above average but not great as it was not close to the beaches or activities and the rooms could be better when compared to other Fairfield Inns as other people have said before.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ms_angelita
Reviews.Content: Small rooms with extremely comfortable beds. Plenty of towels and the room was clean. Good free breakfast with plenty of selections. Free parking in the hotel yard. I can recommend staying here but remember it is pretty far from all the action in central Key West. You will need a car to go to the bach and downtown or take a taxiwherever you go. Not so many things within walking distance except for some shops and restaurants (like FridayÂ´s). One thing I did not like; We stayed on the 2nd floor. The railings had a note attached "Please do not lean on railing" and I felt like the railing could fall down any minute! This made me feel a bit unsafe when walking there with my 2 year old daughter. However I still feel I can recommed this hotel, staff was helpful and rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: margaretmary00
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week before Christmas with my teenage daughter. The weather was a little too cold for the pool but it was nice to eat our breakfast ( which is included)at the pool. Breakfast consisted of a variety of cereals, instant oatmeals, blueberry muffins, yogurts, toasat, bagels, fresh fruit, microwave breakfast sandwiches, juice, coffee, and make your own waffles on a waffle iron. The complimentary USA Today & local Key West newspapers were great. The property was spotless - no garbage, cigarette butts etc. Our room had very comfortable beds and a xtra large shower. The cleaning staff was very friendly. There is also a small business room with 2 computers and printers. Our room is at the back of the propery which I think is much quieter than rooms closer to road.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, Liked it”
Reviews.Author: Misplacedfloridian
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first night of our three night trip at the Fairfield, and the next two at a B&B to be closer to the Square. Wished we would have booked all three at the Fairfield. We had Standby Airline tickets, so appreciated this Inn's cancellation policy. We stayed in room 235 which was a suite and cost us 129.00 for this time of year. December, in my opinion, is a great time to go to the Keys. Our room was on the back poolside of the complex and was very large and worth money on Key West standards. The outer rooms did look a great deal smaller, and watch not to get rooms to close to the busy road. The positives of our stay were the room, very helpful front desk dudes, huge resort style pool, giant breakfast bar, nice Tiki bar, and free parking. The negative would have to be only that it is too far to walk to the Square, but there are several other options. They have bike rentals on sight (plenty close of enough to all spots of interest by bike), Old town trolleys stops in the parking lot, and the actual City Bus (2 dollars) stop is just about 100yds up the street(look for the sign). The schedule for the City bus, if youâ€™re venturous, can be printed on line. I didnâ€™t really think the Old town trolley was worth the money. There are other must mentions of our trip to Key West. Our favorite thing we did was our sunset cruise on the Schooner the Halie & Matthew. We walked up as they were about to set sail and they knocked the price down to $45 each and it was a grand and relaxing 2 hour sail. We enjoyed lunch at Kellyâ€™s, good conch fritters and the southernmost microbrewery (on location) Red Ale was super. Dinner at the Conch Republic was good, but pricey. Did some Inet searching about all the young Russians in Key West. Seems there is some authority head turning in order to have cheap labor working the shops, with â€œcontractorsâ€� getting them in without proper papers. But I must admit, they were all very courteous. Also, consider flying in to Miami, instead of Key West, the drive is scenic and just about 3 hours this time of year. Hit the No Name Pub in No Name Key on the way.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like family!”
Reviews.Author: Marlajean40
Reviews.Content: My husband to be and I, planned our wedding in Key West and wanted to reserve a block of rooms for our family and friends. I was put in touch with Schelby Betz, the Director of Sales, and she took care of everything. Schelby and everyone that we came in contact with at the Fairfield, treated us like part of the family. The hotel was beautiful, comfortable, clean and our whole group, including the kids, enjoyed themselves. We were 25 adults and 5 children and everyone at the Fairfield was accomodating and pleasant. We want to go back every year now, for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: cran
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful, and the staff is excellent. Continental breakfast was great. There is free parking though it is too far to walk to the beaches and Duval St. from the hotel. However, nothing else was good about the hotel. The rooms are very small. Our room smelled strongly of mildew. The rooms need much better housekeeping and a thorough cleaning. The hotel is on a main thoroughfare and rather noisy at night with cars, scooters, motorcycles passing through. The uncomfortable beds creaked and squeaked. This is by far the worst Fairfield Inn, we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price in Key West”
Reviews.Author: sj102
Reviews.Content: Most hotel facing ocean is high in rent. compared to that this hotel rent was affordable. It is away from ocean but you can get to it using rental bike. Breakfast they serve is okay, nothing great, though it is free. rooms are clean only but nothing to get too excited about. Parking is free. This hotel short distance away from Duval street. We parked in municepal parking lot and it was 1.50 per hour. then you can walk to Duval street. Glassbottom boat tour was not spectacular. Not much variety of fish we could see. we tried the mexican restrauant and food was good. They all add 18% service charge so watch your bill as tips is already included.

Reviews.Title: “I would book here again.”
Reviews.Author: Cincy922
Reviews.Content: The front desk people were very helpful and friendly. I liked that our room had a tile floor and not carpeting. The bed was very comfortable and even though we brought our own pillows, we didn't need them because the pillows they had were fine. We also had extra towels and got bigger towels for the pool. Breakfast was more than adequate and the pool area was very enjoyable. We were only sorry that the pool didn't have a hot tub too.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, small and overpriced rooms, but exceptionally friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: Almost all of Key West's lodgings are overpriced, so paying $137/night (including taxes) for an average motel/hotel room at the roadside Fairfield is not too bad. But the slightly worn-out rooms are not even as large as at a typical Best Western -- they also lack closets, and the furniture in ours was pretty rickety. Not many electrical outlets either. On the plus side, wi-fi, breakfast and parking are all free. The staff are really A+. From the friendly check-in clerks to the efficient housekeeping and maintenance, everyone who works here seems to genuinely care about guests enjoying their stay. Hurrah!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty/nonhelpful”
Reviews.Author: byelderman
Reviews.Content: We got there late and walked around the room putting our stuff away. Since the first thing I do is kickoff my shoes I was appauled by the fact that the bottom of my feet were BLACK... all of ours were. The floors were filthy. Not only that but when we decided to call it a night and get into bed one of my friends said the sheets were gritty. I thought she was just being picky until I got in my bed and found the same gritty sheets. We called the office and the maintenance guy just came and threw the sheets at us and they landed on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynneP
Reviews.Content: Was a bit further away from all the downtown Key West activities than I expected, but nice facility. Helpful staff. Very nice pool area and great free breakfast buffet in the pool area. Room was kind of cramped with very small bathroom. Not a lot of storage or room to put your suitcases, but adequate. I know I read reviews before about the air conditioning units being loud and it's true. If you are a light sleeper, I'd take ear plugs. Only real complaint I have is the pool area is supposed to close at 11:00. All the rooms open up to the pool area, so any activity out there at night can be heard. There was a large group of mostly men that decided to play dominoes. The constant talking and shuffling of the dominoes on the tables echoed throughout the courtyard area and had to be keeping everyone awake. This went on until 2am or so. I would have thought the hotel staff would have cleared them out.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dolce19
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairfield was very pleasant. The front desk staff was very helpful and greeted us with sample strawberry daiquiris upon arrival. We were also given a handful of coupons for buy one get one free deals at local clubs and restaurants (mostly for drinks). They also gave us multiple phone numbers for taxi services and the bus schedule. The bus picks up right near the hotel. We were equipped with a map of Key West and the man at the desk was very kind to explain all of the different areas. The hotel also has a list of restaurant recommendations, which are staff favorites. Unfortunately the bus doesn't travel too late. We stayed in a two room suite that was very clean. The living room area was a tad small and the layout awkward, but it was alright. The master suite was very large with a huge comfortable bed with clean white sheets. The bathroom was also very clean. The continental breakfast was average - waffles, Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, fruit, juice, hard boiled eggs, cereals are some of the items I remember. The pool area was very nice. The chairs were arranged to make you feel like you were at a private pool. There was a tiki bar (only open until 7 PM); the bartender wasnâ€™t too friendly. The Duval street is not far from the hotel, only a couple of minutes by car. I would not walk. There is also a many franchise restaurants and grocery stores nearby. We only paid $130 a night, so our room was a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - pleasant staff - clean rooms - good location - priced well”
Reviews.Author: VerbBatonRouge
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were very nice. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The breakfast was lacking in choice but enough to hold you until lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: stargazin
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, clean room. Room was a little small but nicely decorated. Nice bathroom but no fan. Best free continental breakfast of any other hotels I've stayed at. Very nice pool area, Tiki bar. Fitness room. Free Cofee in the lobby in the evenings was very nice and the cofee actually good-and flavored creamers! Free paper at breakfast. They have bike and scooter rental on site and the Trolley stops there as well. Overall, I felt this was a great hotel for what we paid. It is not within walking distance to Duval area but it is not far either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - staff, location and pool all excellent, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: countyfanuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I stayed at the Casa Marina as well during my vacation and in terms of overall value, the Fairfield comes out top every time. The team at the front desk (Ildi, Nora, Kelly and Natalie) were simply awesome, recommending some wonderful trips, they were very friendly and always smiling. They made us feel welcome every time we entered the lobby area and they always called us by our names after we checked in. They are a great bunch of people. The free breakfast, parking and coffee and juice in the lobby just shows how this hotel is different from others In Key West - no rip extra charges. The pool area is fantastic and the rooms are always clean and adequate in terms of size. Thanks for helping us to enjoy our stay and have a great vacation. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Marriott comes through as usual”
Reviews.Author: ohnine
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites for the weekend. The accommodations were pleasant and the complimentary breakfast in the morning was the perfect way to start the day!...The young lady at the desk who checked us in (Nora from Hungary) was most helpful and was able to put another couple of friends in the room next to ours....truly enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MOGrl79
Reviews.Content: I work for a different hotel chain and have pretty high standards! I could not have been more pleased with our stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Key West! The service was wonderful. The lady who was at the front desk most of the time (she was from Hungry) remembered us and was awsome! She accomodated all of our requests. Our room was wonderful. The pool was always great, clean and relaxed. Pete was was always at the Tiki bar to help us out. On our 1st night he recognized that we were "new" and asked for our ID"s ... after that, he knew us by face! The breakfast was adequate and service still great as well! We did have to take a Taxi from the hotel to downtown, however met some great people with wonderful info as a result (Hi Ben from Israel!!). All in all I'd stay here again and give this hotel 2 thumbs up!! Great job!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lovingthesummer56
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here during our 2 days in Key West. It was quiet, rooms were clean, staff pleasant. The pool is awesome with 12 small fountains spraying into it during the day. Complimentary breakfast is served poolside--nothing spectacular on the menu, but it's a very pleasant way to start the day. Would recommend it, although farther up the island (northeast?) are other places that are directly across from the seawall and might offer better Gulf access/views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but noisy location”
Reviews.Author: strasmanUk
Reviews.Content: looking on the map this looks like a nice out of the way location. Wrong. It would seem that the road running along the front of the hotel is one of the main roads into Key West. First room seemed was not a suite as described when I booked it and you could put your fingers into the gap around the front door. There was so much road noise that there might as well have not been a front door. We immediately went back to reception and complained. We had to wait 15 mins but were then given a room on the first floor with a front door that did keep the noise out but was still traffic facing (maybe they keep the better rooms for families staying for more than 1 night).Tthe room was very nice and in a good state of repair. If you call a larger room with a double bed and a sofa bed a suite then you will not be disappointed. I do not so I was. The buffet breakfast was ok for free as long as you do not have high expectations and you don't mind sitting in an open covered area with only fans and no a/c (not so good as it was 89 degrees at 0800). You do sit along side a lovely pool though, one of the better features of this hotel. Also the free plentiful parking (some even under cover) is also one of the better features of the hotel. My suggestion, ask for a room at the back of the hotel and things will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: diverdude2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value. The staff was pleasant and breakfast was good. Front desk staff were very friendly. The hotel is located on a busy street but the layout of the room minimized any traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly - Pool and Breakfast were the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Smittythepiper
Reviews.Content: We entered and were given a little cup of punch that was very nice. The rental for the bikes on hotel property is pretty much in line with the rest of the island. We opted for a scooter on day three after our rear ends got tired of pedaling - although everything was within pedal distance. Try to get a "four stroke" scooter. They aren't loud and obnoxious. It'll take about ten minutes of biking to get to Duval street. The bar at the pool was nice and had daily specials. If I had a complaint - it would be the road noise since it is located on a main street. The way to the hot spots is from the back streets behind the hotel, so it can be confusing - even for a directionally gifted person like me. We got a room on the back side and asked to get one poolside and they had no problem with it. I'd go back - Its just far enough away from the chaos but the business district of the island is right there. So there is good and bad. Once you are at the pool with the fountain going you forget all of your worries. The pool and breakfast was Awesome and made it for me. Im glad we stayed there and the price was right. Dont expect the Taj Mahal and you'll have fun. Clean, friendly, and pleasant - not decadent.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - Waste money on transport”
Reviews.Author: CinLoo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Key West for my sister's 30th. Key West is GREAT! But thatâ€™s not what this review is for - Fairfield Inn offered a great front desk team. They were very attentive, informative and friendly. Whether you needed a cab, directions or suggestions on where to eat - what beach to visit - or the best night club, they offered a long list of suggestions with pros and cons. The rooms were quite small though. There were 3 girls in ours and we constantly needed to move out of the way for someone to walk by. However, the beds were GREAT! Very soft and cozy (down pillows). Room 222 offers a lovely view - of the Taco Bell's roof next to the hotel too! Also, this is more of a motel (rather than hotel) - so not sure why they didn't have seats outside the rooms - seemed to have enough room. The pool was very refreshing, and a nice size with plenty of chairs - you never had that feel that the pool was over crowed. My big beef was the location. We took a cab about 4 times a day into Downtown or the beach. With being 5 of us (about $20 a ride) - this was split and generally inexpensive - but I think next time I visit Key West, I'll buck up the extra money and stay at a better location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: okehpol
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days at this hotel and found it to be a fabulous place to stay for holiday to Key West. The staff were all very friendly, helpful, nothing was too much trouble, particularly Ellen from England, The room was clean and loved the large shower! The pool area was lovely, beds always available and towels provided by the hotel. The location of the hotel was great, just 2 miles from the nightlife! Although the hotel is situated on the roadside it was not noisy. Would recommnend a stay here

Reviews.Title: “Looking Farther Afield Next Time”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict941
Reviews.Content: There are a few things that I look for in a hotel when staying for leisure. The first is cleanliness and overall appearance. The Fairfield Inn is situated on busy Roosevelt Boulevard about 2 miles or so from Duval Street. That is fine if you have a car, but when utilizing public transportation, the bus stop is on the opposite side of the road and walking there is dangerous for there is no sidewalk on the side of the hotel. The hotel is painted in bright Key West colors and the hotel lobby is comfortable and nicely appointed. The room was clean and brightly painted as well, but nothing to write home about. The bar was the highlight of the hotel because it appeared handsome and sleek with its dark wood table and white panels. The pool is a huge free form, but a little gaudy with numerous shell statues (12 to be exact) around the edges spitting water into the pool. The pool depth remains fairly shallow at all ends, probably no more than 4.5' deep. The second thing I look for is customer service. When we entered the hotel lobby we were greeted by a young lady who took care of our reservations and the gentleman behind her gave us two cups of strawberry slush to welcome us. That was a nice gesture because it was sweltering outside! They young lady also gave us valuable information, like what time sunset was and where the best place to watch it was and a map to get there. From there we needed extra towels at one point in the stay and it took over twenty minutes for anyone to come after we had been told they were, so we called the front desk and cancelled the request. Lastly, perks. The hotel serves breakfast which consists of english muffins, bagels, oatmeal, yogurts, cereal, breakfast sandwiches, juices, coffee, tea, etc. There are newspapers for you to peruse as well as a fitness center on site, which we did not use. We did, however, use the computer in the small business center which was helpful. So, I would say that this stay was "eh...ok". Why? I really wish there was some water pressure coming out of my shower head. The water saver seems like a great idea, but I wonder if I would have stayed so long in a shower where the shower head actually had pressure. Maybe, maybe not. Also, logistically getting to our room was awkward. Wish the layout was more natural. And I really wish there were sidewalks on that side of the street! So those gripes along with the positive recent renovation earn this hotel an "average" in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rothmla
Reviews.Content: We were very positively surprised by our stay at The Fairfield Inn in Key West--the staff greeted us warmly, provided useful discount coupons for several restaurants in town and were genuinely pleasant to deal with for the 3 days we stayed--including extending our checkout on a very popular weekend. The hotel is remodeled and the rooms are very adequate, the breakfast included in the room rate provided was really quite good with a broad assortment of food. The fitness room had relatively new equipment. The pool is really quite amazing. It is located within 5-7 minutes of Duval Street. Unlike some other reviews, we found that it was quiet and did not encounter any road noise. The free wifi worked quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: JMRN
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Fairfield Inn Key west in mid-January of this year. I would say this Fairfield is a notch above other Fairfield Inns I've stayed in; and most of those were more than adequate. I loved the decor in the room. We were told that the hotel had recently renovated. I really like the color scheme and the tile flooring (hotel carpet always seems kind of nasty to me!) We only had a shower; no tub; but it was a very large walk-in, glass shower. The room was very clean and I loved that we had a regular 4-cup coffeemaker instead of what seems to be the latest trend (one-cuppers). We usually travel with our own coffee and I really hate it when we can't use it! The breakfast selections were pretty good. They offered the Jimmy Dean breakfast biscuits if you like those; as well as boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, yogurt, and the usual donuts/pastries. Free wireless internet is provided as well if you have a laptop. I believe there is a business center if you don't. We also utilized the laundry, which is on the second floor close to the pool area. The hotel will provide detergent free of charge for you if you need it (we had our own), and it costs a straight $1 per load to wash and $1 to dry (amazingly, not just for 10 minutes like you usually get in a laundromat, but depending upon the size of your load, up to 45 minutes drying time!)The staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking at the hotel is free. It is a short drive to the action in Key West, although parking downtown can be a bit of a hassle. We found all-day parking for $10; reasonable compared to some. The pool area was lovely, but we didn't utilize it as we were pretty busy and it was a little on the cool side when we were there. I would definitely recommend the Fairfield if you're visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 disguided as Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Eujay
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the worst hotel in Key West, The flashy website deceives the customer into thinking that this will be a hotel worhy of the Marriott name. This hotel is comparable to a Motel 6 and is located on the side of the main troute/freeeway through Key West. At $ 250.00 per night it is overpiced and does not deserve to be part of the Marriott chain. This is an $ 80.00 room in any other location. Rooms are extremely small and cramped. The rooms have no soundproofing and you will hear all of the traffic going by in the nearby highway. Continental breakfast was below average. Staff do not make eye contact and do not seem to have a positive/can do approach to service. Location is in a disreputable part of town. I woke up at 2 a.m. hearing two guys shouting profanites at eachother in the street below. Police sirens folowed shortly afterwards. I stayed one nigh then found a "real" Mariott. True to form the Fairfield Inn insisted on charging me for the second night even though I made it clear that I did not want to stay there. Definetly not reccomended for families with small children/elderly people. I will never stay at the Fairfield Inn Key West again

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: FlyGirlHeather
Reviews.Content: I don't know the cost of this hotel because I booked our stay with my Marriott Rewards points. Front desk staff was friendly and gave lots of great pointers and a coupon pack. Parking was free and that is a huge plus in KW. Breakfast was included (a nice surprise) and it was awesome with lots of hot/cold and healthy choices. Location isn't great, about 2 miles from downtown, definitely walkable but a scooter is preferred. (On that note don't rent a scooter from the hotel because they're way overpriced! Do your research- there are a million scooter rental places all over town.) The room is adequate but who cares because you're rarely in it! There were some little bugs but this is Florida after all... No room service. Local restaurants will deliver but we didn't try it. Nice pool, try to get a room on the back side overlooking the pool instead of near the busy street. On a side note- the next time I visit Key West I'm going to use my points for the Courtyard by Marriott simply because of their shuttle! That hotel has a shuttle that will take you downtown, but we kept seeing it all over the island! My boyfriend and I were joking around about the amazing Courtyard shuttle because it was the only hotel shuttle we saw.

Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: superal2
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel, nice swimming-pool area, very nice staff !! The only complain it's the noise of the street (Rosevelt Blvd), very noisy at night ! but anyway not a fault from the hotel. Free parking, no hidden extra charge, they gave us a second cocktail for free at the swimming-pool bar. The breakfast was simple but quality was there, you can make yourself some waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool & people but room is mediocre for price”
Reviews.Author: JonathanandAnita
Reviews.Content: We read reviews of The Fairfield Inn prior to booking . We then decided to book a one-bedroom suite. In our opinion, the reviews over-rated the standard of the rooms. We expected our accommodation to provide more comfort than it did. It's very clean, provides for all needs, and has been refurbished fairly recently. The breakfast is fine too, with many options, both hot and cold. The Fairfield offers a great pool, the staff are very helpful and friendly (except the barmaid who obviously thinks customers interfere with her work and only cheers up slightly at "tip time"!) and the location isn't bad either - about 3 miles from Duvall St. - around $10 by taxi. If you are thinking of taking the sightseeing tram, note that it uses The Fairfield as a regular stop point - the downside is that the service stops around 5pm. The Fairfield offers trouble-free accommodation - just expect an "adequate" room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Value - Good Continental Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Texvacation
Reviews.Content: Good price for the money. Noisy with doors slamming. No charm. Loud AC. Location not great. Very good continental breakfast. We checked out after one night and moved closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: TBegay
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Key West which was plenty enough for us to see everything we wanted....Rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly...even the guys who rented us scooters for a day were extremely helpful. Recommend the scooters for a thrill ride into town! The pool was nice and very clean with plenty of chairs. The free breakfast was ample and a fairly large variety to choose from. This hotel is about 2 miles from all the action but far enough away that you can get some sleep....My biggest complaint would be the noise of the ongoing A/C it runs 24/7 and can barely keep the room cool enough. overall a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Average tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: tk63
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard room, but could fortunately get a suite. The suites are great! Nice large bed, clean, separate desk and fridge. The standard rooms are very small and do not have any room to store luggage. Very friendly staff at the front desk. Coffee, soda, cookies all for free at the reception area. Great pool and okay gym. Lots of parking space. Just 5 minutes to the old town. Close to shopping and restaurant area's.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average ~ Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BeeDeeBee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved 2 rooms ~ one suite and one regular room. The suite had a king bed in a separate room (no doors to close room off though) and also a pull out sofa in the living room area. Both rooms had TV's. There was a mini fridge, coffeepot and microwave in the hall/foyer and a very large bathroom with stand up shower. We also had a balcony that overlooked the pool area but our room had a shade tree directly in front, which was nice for privacy. Our room was either newly renovated or it was in excellent shape and very clean. Floors were tiled and walls very clean. Beds and bedding extremely new, comfortable and clean. AC was running in tip top shape and kept the room cool at all times. This room ran $10 per nite more than a standard room. The kids stayed in the standard room which was small but tastefully done as the suite. I wished I had reserved 2 suites because they would have appreciated the larger room and it was only $10 a night more. The standard room didn't have a microwave or mini fridge though. The pool here is beautiful and very clean. There are fountains around the entire pool. Staff were outside at all times sweeping and cleaning the area. Although there are signs on the pool entrance to not bring in outside drinks or food, we did bring in some food from a nearby fast food restaurant late at night and sat at the bar area tables. Staff never said anything to us. This place does not serve food. The outside bar/breakfast area is also very tidy and clean. Breakfast is served out here and we felt this was appropriate for our needs (continental style). The reception area was very clean. Every day they served cookies and a non-alcoholic beverage on the center reception table. Coffee and hot tea was also served in this room. There is a small business center where you can use the internet on nice updated computers and other equipment. Staff was very knowledgeable and pleasant. Although this hotel is located in the "new" Key West, I would definitely stay here again without hesitation. I would also recommend it to anyone that has stayed in the "old" part in the past (like us) and was looking for something affordable, clean, and without the constant hustle and bustle that "old" town offers. It took less than 5 minutes to get to the "old" part of town via car.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 room was like a Closet”
Reviews.Author: sunsetandsprits
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was like staying at a motel 6. The room was so small I felt like the walls were closing in on me. The room also needed some heavy duty cleaning there was dust on the walls so thick that when the air conditioning was on the dust would blow everywhere. In the shower there was dirt in the corners yuck! We ended up checking out early because it did not feel like a safe place to stay with our family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value For You Money”
Reviews.Author: keywestbeachbum
Reviews.Content: Nice tiles, fresh linen, and clean room. Safe environment. Beautiful pool. Knowledgeable staff helped us get around the island. Don't miss Mallory Square Sunset Celebration and the restaurants on Duval St., many do not accept American Express.Try the sunset catamaran and duo para-sailing. Had a great time! Noisy A/C but would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but room very small”
Reviews.Author: SteveKY
Reviews.Content: Picked the Fairfield Inn mainly for their reputation and the rate. Turned out that it's about 2 miles from most of the downtown attractions (Duval St.). There are several buildings that make-up the property. The front buildings seem new, but the back two buildings have the look of an old 1950's motel that has been repainted and remodeled. We stayed in a room in one of these buildings -- very small room. I mean VERY small. However, it was clean. The "courtyard" pool was also nice, and seemed new. The "tiki bar" left something to be desired -- especially the bartender. He seemed a little bothered most of the time, and didn't seem to enjoy his position. Would've also been nice to have a waitress circling the pool, taking drink orders. Parking was OK at the hotel, but it's lack of proximity to Duval St. meant driving downtown and paying at least $10 per night to park there. Breakfast was normal Fairfield Inn fare. Price was right -- just nothing special about it. Not a bad place to stay though, even with some of the issues mentioned here.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms”
Reviews.Author: dpoli
Reviews.Content: Despite reading other reviews stating that the rooms were very small, we booked a suite for our 3 day stay in Key West. The property is off the beaten track and easily located. Our first impression was that we were not going to enjoy the Fairfield Inn. However, the building where you checkin was very nice and the desk clerks very helpful. The pool was very nice and the lobby inviting, so we figured that we would be OK. We were assigned a suite on the first floor. However, the first floor requires stairs/elevator--not good for persons with physical impairments. The Fairfield Inn has exterior corridors, which presents safety issues. Upon entering the unit, we were shocked at the cavelike atmosphere. Not only was the "suite" extremely small, but with very low ceilings and little light, it had a claustrophobic feeling. The bedroom was decent sized, with tile floors and a king bed. The bathroom was huge--especially considering how small the room was. The pie shaped " living room" had a sleeper sofa and built in refrig/microwave. The problem with this arrangement is safety. Not only is the sleeper sofa near the entrance, but right above it is a window on the exterior corridor, making it easy for child snatching . Also of concern is a fire issue---with the sleeper sofa opened, there is no way to walk around it in the event of a fire. Because of the safety issues, we checked out of the Fairfiled Inn . The desk clerk, Kelly, was very understanding and gracious and offered to move us. But because all of the rooms had exterior entrances, we chose to decline her offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Motelish”
Reviews.Author: MoteChristo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the regular rooms not the suites and the verdict is: Very Motelish. I felt like I was in a motel out in the boonies. This Fairfield Inn does not measure up to Fairfield Inn standards. So you end up asking yourself: 'I paid $160.00/night for THIS?' Rooms were clean but there was no closet; there was just a clothes hanging area and a rack. The building has too much street access, so you end up sleeping with one eye open. Exercise room was pretty good. The pool area was nice but who needs it when there are nice beaches with swimable water around. For next time, I'd probably choose something else.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Fairfield/Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: LLHamilton
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn for one night last week. The pool and breakfast areas are certainly beautiful. The older rooms, which I was told were "gutted and redone", are still lacking. The door jamb was missing on the first room we were in so the noise from street traffic was unbelievable. The staff were very kind and moved us to a room toward the back. The noise from traffic was less but, the noise from the air conditioner kept us up most of the night. Try to get a suite in the new section of the hotel if booking at this location.

Reviews.Title: “The Comforts of Fairfield Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: Karyn01
Reviews.Content: I must say, almost as great as the comforts of your own home. Being that this was my first time to The Keys, I thought I would be disappointed not being right there in the center of all the action on Duval Street. Wow, I'm glad I wasn't in the middle of the action. If I choose to go back to The Keys, Fairfield Inn would be my choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: keysagain
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice of hotel. The staff was great, friendly and helpful. The hotel is well maintained, pool area was relaxing and you should try the drink of the day! If available would recommend one of the suites.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: locovirus
Reviews.Content: i was a little scared after reading reviews on how the rooms were supposed to be a bit small. BOY was relieved when we walked into our King bed and studio room. we had 6 people stay in it yes 6 people. we had 2 on the king bed 2 on the fold out couch and we also brought 2 air matresses. this was by far one of the bigger hotel rooms we have stayed at. Even with 6 people we had plenty of room to walk around and hang out. the pool was very nice so were the staff. the breakfast was amazing i would say the best free breakfast i have had at a hotel. i would def stay at this hotel again. I am not sure about the other rooms but our King bed in studio was just simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: 06blasterboy
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield is a very nice place it is off duval street, which is a good thing, because you dont have to listen to drunk spring breakers all night. The breakfast was excellent for a hotel and for a family of 4 or 5 the rooms are spacious and have 2 rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: michigansnow1
Reviews.Content: This Feb of 2008 my wife and I stayed with the Marriot Fairfield Inn and Suites. We had a wonderful time! Checking in was a breeze with the very courtious and respectful staff assisting us with our bags and the introduction to the islands offerings. The staff were able to help us with our planning of trips throughout the three days we stayed, they assisted us with our transportation needs, sunset cruises, and most importantly our resturant choices. Getting around the island, we though would be troublesome, but the staff told us about the new scooter and bike rental company on property, directly next to the pool. We stopped in at the rental place called AHI Rentals and found the rates to be very pleasing to our wallets, we rented two scooters and never had to pay for a cab or any type of parking during our whole trip (saved us so much money and time) The hotel has a wonderful breakfast for a limited selection, jimmy dean sandwiches, bagels, coffee and juices, fruits and cereals. Oh, and the pool! such a wonderful and enjoyable area around the compound. We found the rooms to be very cozy, the beds were comfortable for being away from our own bed at home, and the housekeeping cleaned everything. Checking out was also a so very simple. Under our door was our bill early in the morning. We did not even have to step into the lobby before leaving. High recommendation for the hotel and staff! Thank you very much

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: Insperata
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and only complaint is that our suite was no bigger than the standard room, it just consisted of a king bed and pull out couch. Not worth the higher price we paid, and staff said they would not honor AAA for that room. The pool was beautiful and the free breakfast on the patio was great.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: gell_nilsson
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Located somewhat "off", but inside this is a really nice hotel. The lobby is beautiful, and so is the pool area with wonderful trees and flowers. The standard room is small for four persons (as we are), but alltogether we enjoyed our stay. Excellent concierge (thanks Bob for helping us with the snorkling trip)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: panforgold
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently renovated and is in good shape, staff is courteous and helpful, provide a complementary breakfast that is satisfying, pool is very nice and the workout gym has precor equipment and is in good shape, the room was clean and tidy. The air conditioner was noisy just like others have said but if you can tune it out, no problem. We had a car and drove into town but not a terrible walk and the trolley is available if you don't have a car. On leaving key west our flight was cancelled so we stayed an extra night at the Radisson (courtesy of US Airways). Nice hotel staff but dirty room rugs and pretty run down in general. It made us think highly of the Fairfield.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled to the bone!!”
Reviews.Author: Ice Cream Lady
Reviews.Content: We had plans to stay here 2 nights in the beginning of Jan. '08. At the time Key west was having an unusual cold wave. We checked in and our room was very cold - to be exact 62 degrees. The walls were cold and there were drafts everywhere. The thermostat said heat on it so we tried to turn it on - no heat. We called the front desk only to be told there was no heat in the entire hotel. They said the room would warm up eventually and if we wanted they would send us extra blankets. Well, it got colder. We asked to be moved across the street to the Courtyard, which had HEAT! After, many calls to Marriott, we moved across the street where it was warm. How can a hotel not have any heat!!! I understand that the weather was unusual, but it can happen. Thermostats say heat on them but do not work for heat only a/c. This hotel has just under gone a complete make over. I guess installing heat was too costly!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but....”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum22271
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn for 8 days. We read the reviews before booking, most people complained about the rooms being to small and a very noisy a/c, we thought people were being a bit too picky but they were right...The rooms are very small and the a/c is extremely noisy. The room only has a shower, no tub, it was an inconvience for us since we where traveling with a 2 year old that usually only takes baths. Other than that, the rooms are very clean, great continental breakfast, friendly staff and a great value. My older son enjoyed the free internet service in the lobby. We visit Key West frequently, all in all we had a great time in Key West, not sure if I would stay at the Fairfield Inn again. Be sure to try the pizza at the Upper Crust across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Mom review...”
Reviews.Author: MomToMom
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults, a 17 yr old daughter, and an 8 yr old son) stayed here on our first trip to Key West. Since the hubby had some Marriott points to use, we decided to stay here for five nights using points. We were disappointed at the location of the hotel (on a busy road) and the tiny room. And I meanâ€¦ TINY, the first thing my husband said was â€œIâ€™m glad this is free!â€�. There was no spare wall space to put a suitcase on the floor so we unloaded three suitcases into the three drawers found in the tv cabinet and put the empty suitcases on top of the cabinet. I was so glad that my kids were past the stroller, car seat, crib stage because none of those items would have fit in this room. Despite the close quarters, we had a blast and I think that all the fights over the bathroom and sink brought our family together. My son could not wait to get into the pool which is large and perfect for kids with a ledge all the way around and fountains that squirt constantly into the pool. The staff was excellent. We kept having to turn to them for extra towels because of our many visits to the beach. The free breakfast was good considering it was just a continental breakfast but since my kids are picky eaters, I thought we might have trouble but we didn't. They served the apples, bananas, cereal, bagels, toast, yogurt, waffles from the make your own waffle maker and jimmy dean breakfast sandwiches to microwave. Everything was well stocked and fresh thanks to my favorite staff worker, Barbara from Georgia. She greeted everyone good morning all week and when my son had a waffle sticking problem, she was glad to help. Also, the breakfast dining room is outside and under a large covered area next to the pool. It was a great way to start the day. The housekeeping was great except that they did forget to clean our room once but the next day management came by to check on it. Also they did a good job of keeping up with the sand from the beach everyday. The beds were feather topped and they provided four fluffy pillows per bed, so we all slept fine and didnâ€™t hear any street noise. All said and done, I would come back because of the excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Moo07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would recommend this hotel. We stayed here whilst we were on our honeymoon. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. We upgraded our room and they helped us move our luggage and bought us a drink as we were honeymooners. It's not far to walk into the centre of Key West or getting a taxi isn't too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: jannielb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights for a family wedding. Chose this property because we own Marriott time shares and had wanted to earn some points. The hotel is newly refurbished and very attractive. It is on the main hwy (what isn't???) but noise level wasn't bad. It's not in the heart of the Old Town, but is just a short drive from anywhere. As always, when we arrived, my husband asked if the desk could improve on our king-bedded room. We were immediately upgraded to a mini-suite at no extra charge. The room had a micro-fridge, two tvs, and a nice couch. Made a 3-day stay much more pleasant. We also enjoyed the free breakfast - including the Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches. They reheated easily in the microwave and were a welcome change from the usual continental breakfast fare. We'd definitely stay there again. Staff was very helpful, readily gave us change for parking meters and great maps and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: globetrottersam
Reviews.Content: Me and my wifr stayed here during our stay at Key West before the thanksgiving break. We had booked a king size bed room. On arrival to the room, we found some stench in the room, they instantly upgraded our room to a junior stay. Apart from that the stay has been excellent. The service at the hotel is exceptional. Also the pool area was good. Safe for kids and fun for all alike.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn and Suites Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 2400 North Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040
